659660880.name: Great views
659660880.author: a TripAdvisor user
659660880.reviewBody: We took the boat ride earlier that day and although it\'s not as dirty as it is down there I still saw a lot of trash everywhere.  It\'s hard to appreciate nature when there\'s garbage everywhere.

648307528.name: Epic Canyon to Visit!!!!
648307528.author: a TripAdvisor user
648307528.reviewBody: We took the boat ride the day before, so our wristbands were included in the price. Its a 20 minute drive or so along the top of the canyon, with 5 incredible lookouts over the sumidero river and canyon of 1000M. Absolutely incredible views! Go early to witness it without many people around (I heard it can get busy.)\nIts hours are 8am-5pm every day but it is closed TUESDAY. Definitely a must see!!!

646700851.name: Nature Wonder
646700851.author: a TripAdvisor user
646700851.reviewBody: The Sumidero Canyon is an incredible place to visit. A boat tour (2 hours) is highly recommended to see this place.

633513586.name: Stunning Place
633513586.author: a TripAdvisor user
633513586.reviewBody: This is one of Chiapas landmark... Ca\u00f1on del Sumidero and you can\'t leave without experience this magnificent scenic paradise. It is beautiful but be careful with mosquitoes they are really big and sting badly. But overall you\'ll have an amazing experience.

632037317.name: A need to go place!!!
632037317.author: a TripAdvisor user
632037317.reviewBody: Really nice place to go and visit. You need to go at this place and visit the miradores too. This place is amazing and clearly the place to take great pictures.

616833648.name: Spectacular views and amazing structures
616833648.author: a TripAdvisor user
616833648.reviewBody: I enjoyed my visit because beside the nature\u2019s gifts there are the highway and the structure to enjoy these spectacular views of \u201cEl ca\u00f1\u00f3n del Sumidero\u201d. The ride in the boat was amazing, nice and calmed at the beginning, but quite fast and bumpy! It is important to choose the right travel agencie! It is a must if you go to Chiapas

604704646.name: Amazing views!
604704646.author: a TripAdvisor user
604704646.reviewBody: It will be better if you go in a tour group or with a tour guide. The road is full of dangerous curbs (Sinuous). There are several stops or areas where you can admire the Canyon. You will not find stores or nothing during your trip. Make sure you have enough water for yourself.

603519318.name: The majestic Fjords of Mexico come to life on this river tour !!!
603519318.author: a TripAdvisor user
603519318.reviewBody: We arrived at Chiapa de Corzo on our own. You can do the same, in fact, its cheaper than  having a tour company pick you up at your hotel. All you pay is for the guided boat trip that lasts about 3 hours and is worth every peso !!! We both paid 200 pesos per person  which is about $11.00 dollars each.  Not bad, for a "three hour tour," (sounds like Gilligan\'s Island !!) Anyway, the company is called "Turistica del Grijalva" and ticket agents at the main plaza will show you where to purchase the tickets and take the bus to the river, (all included in the price, by the way) You have to put on a "may west" and get in a boat with about 25 other tourists. Our boatman, Francisco was great !!! He told jokes and gave interesting narratives about the flora and fauna, legends, and geological formations over a loud speaker. And yes, we did see crocodiles, spider monkeys, ducks, cranes, and hawks circling high above thousand foot cliffs. It\'s mysterious and stunning. The tour is all in Spanish, but don\'t let that discourage you. Read up on Sumidero or check it out on the internet before you go and you will still enjoy it. In fact, there was a Dutch family in front of us and they seemed to be enjoying everything just like the rest of us Spanish speakers. One more thing, its best to visit Sumidero from Tuxtla Gutierrez and not San Cristobal de las Casas in which the latter is further away and up in the mountains.

596250361.name: Wow!
596250361.author: a TripAdvisor user
596250361.reviewBody: You just have to see it to believe it. Beautiful to say the least. Light hiking, scenic drive, boat rides available. You have to experience both ways.

595338391.name: Nature at its best!
595338391.author: a TripAdvisor user
595338391.reviewBody: This place is amazing beautiful. All of the miradores give you an awesome view of the canyon.  The entrance fee is minimal.  Take a tour or rent a car.  Its a must do when in Chiapas.  Bring your bug spray!

589282653.name: Amazing!!!!
589282653.author: a TripAdvisor user
589282653.reviewBody: The drive was easy and well maintained.  There are 5 major lookouts that provide different views of the canyon below (all spectacular) and varying in amenities from picknic tables, info signs etc.   As you drive up the canyon, you progressively get higher and higher where you really get a good balance of view points from different angles.   I hear you can contract a taxi intown to do this for you if you don\'t have transportation.  Bring a camera!  It truly is a great place to see the canyon below.

589253057.name: Impresionante
589253057.author: a TripAdvisor user
589253057.reviewBody: All this experience was the most interesting trip i ever made in my life. The views are awesomely high and the sound of the nature is a lot more interesting.

572254653.name: Awesome experience
572254653.author: a TripAdvisor user
572254653.reviewBody: It is a must visit location for your trip in Tuxtla. Breathtaking views will make it a very special and unforgettable experience!

572048926.name: Worth the minimal cost and time
572048926.author: a TripAdvisor user
572048926.reviewBody: Read the reviews and was iffy if this experience would be worthwhile but it was perfect on a hot, sunny day. The breeze and spray of water from the boat were enough but getting to see a variety of birds, monkeys, and crocodiles made it even better. Gorgeous scenery and the guide pointed out some really cool spots to check out. They take you to the dam where there were boat vendors selling cold beverages and fresh cut fruit that was delicious. Boat trip was just long enough to get a good sense of the land but not too long that we were bored. Easy enough to navigate- paid in cash, grabbed some life vests, sat and waited for a boat, and hopped on. Wait time was not too long and sitting area is shaded. Bathrooms available for some pesos and plenty of souvenir-type stuff to buy.

568104179.name: Phantastich Views
568104179.author: a TripAdvisor user
568104179.reviewBody: Unfortunately, this is something you need a car to do, and do it after the boat ride through the canyon, as on the boat tours, they will give you a paper armwrist which is also the entry ticket to the Miradores. If you do have a car, you can do the boat tour and the tour to the Miradores in one day - and it is absolutely worth it because the views in the canyon are phantastic.

557648581.name: Boat trip not to be missed
557648581.author: a TripAdvisor user
557648581.reviewBody: About 16 people filled a small boat and motored 2 plus hours on a lovely day through a fantastically lush canyon in Chiapa de Corzo. The operator pulled over to point out monkeys, a crocodile, egrets, etc. Beautiful and awesome views!!

557574373.name: Don\u2019t hesitate. Go!
557574373.author: a TripAdvisor user
557574373.reviewBody:
I have to admit I toured Miradores in style :-) I only had one and a half days in Tuxtla. I took the boat tour of the canyon on the first day. Having only a couple of hours on the second day, I stopped a taxi on the street. The guy charged me 500 pesos to go to pick up my luggage, take me to the national park and drop me off at the airport. I, probably, could’ve bargained or wave another taxi but I decided it was worth spending around $30. 

The views are absolutely stunning. There are five vista points that offer different perspectives. My taxi driver turned out to be quite knowledgeable (an unexpected bonus), offered explanations and some history. 

It was interesting to see the view from above after taking the boat tour a day before. 

If you have time, definitely do both.

554119449.name: Maravilla!
554119449.author: a TripAdvisor user
554119449.reviewBody: Never expected how beautiful this would be. Interesting and I marveled at everything I saw.  They talked about the government cleaning it but I could still see trash in certain places. That\'s sad.   What I loved was to discover animals on the edges of the water.  \nOjala puedan limpiar mas el canon, es triste ver como el hombre llena de basura una reserva natural tan hermosa.

542734679.name: Special views
542734679.author: a TripAdvisor user
542734679.reviewBody: We have taken the two hour tour which was awesome. Nice view of the canyon. Monkeys, alligators, and a lot of sun. Do not miss it\n

540438877.name: Worderfull viewpoints
540438877.author: a TripAdvisor user
540438877.reviewBody: When visiting the Canon Del Sumidero - it is in my opinion at least as important to see them from above, as from a boat.  And if you have a problem with your back or need more comfort, drop the very touristic boat ride and enjoy the viewpoints instead.

539811198.name: Chiapas\' Own Grand Canyon
539811198.author: a TripAdvisor user
539811198.reviewBody: Astounding canyon, river, and view!  Our guide drove us up to the end of the road to do some birding early before the park opened.  What a treat, and what views!  Constantly changing vistas to rival any canyon anywhere.  Great birds too!

508891729.name: A nice view of the canon
508891729.author: a TripAdvisor user
508891729.reviewBody: We did visit the canon on a nice day in August 2017. We had a lunch before the boat trip on the river banks. We departed with a boat full of 20 persons. We had a 2 hour boat trip with the view of the river banks and the electricity barrier. (EFD). On the way we say some pelicans, ibis birds, and other wild life as well as some plastic soep. The guide did only speak Spannish, how ever the ride was interesten enough to be entertained. We had a servers rain storm on our trip, though that did not dare the organisation.

500514242.name: Wonderful views
500514242.author: a TripAdvisor user
500514242.reviewBody: We arrived just ten minutes before closing, but still were able to drive up to the top to enjoy the spectacular view of the canyon.  Our wrist band got us 10% off the boat ride on the river the next day.

497732498.name: Stunning vistas, Friendly people
497732498.author: a TripAdvisor user
497732498.reviewBody: Canyon del Sumidero well worth the visit especially when in combination with the various look out points from the canyon rim above.  Just wish there was more floating trash control and removal.  Must be hard to keep up.  Schools can do their part but respect for the environment has to start at home.

483639071.name: El Mirador
483639071.author: a TripAdvisor user
483639071.reviewBody: As you drive throuhg the winding road, you can stop at different lookouts to admire and awe at the wonderful canyon that lies below you.

482250210.name: excellent views
482250210.author: a TripAdvisor user
482250210.reviewBody: you need to do the canon del sumidero excursion on boat, in my personal opinion is better than go to the miradores first.Keep the bracelet that they give to you when take the excursion on boat at the canon because with this bracelet you can go for free to the miradores Otherwise you will need to pay for entering in the miradores.

476518615.name: Spectacular views
476518615.author: a TripAdvisor user
476518615.reviewBody: The park is almost 30 KM routes with 5 main viewpoints to stop and appreciate from the highs the majesty of nature of Ca\u00f1on del Sumidero, really a wonderful experience in Tuxtla Gutierrez to enjoy the trip and experience from another point of view the Usumasinta River, with proper services and security. With the option to ride in mountain bike.

462109359.name: Spectacular Ca\u00f1on Experience
462109359.author: a TripAdvisor user
462109359.reviewBody: Total tour is 3 \u00bd hours and is magnificent! Ca\u00f1on starts out gradually with water about 1200\' wide. On the way we see & photograph two enormous crocs. Beautiful bird species after that, then howler monkeys in the trees. Then the deeper we go, the narrower and steeper it gets. Highest point is 1KM above river, most is 700-800m. And experience is awesome. At narrowest point it\'s 100\', then widens out again to about 100m.

460548202.name: Great scenery and interesting information about Hydro electric services in Chiapas
460548202.author: a TripAdvisor user
460548202.reviewBody: This is a fast-paced boat ride that lasts about two hours and takes you all the way through the Sumidor canyon. There are lots of interesting things to see along the way including caves, a cave with a statue of the virgin of Guadalupe, all types of birds, butterflies and crocodiles. When you get to the dam  there is a floating lunch boat that offers you things to drink and to nibble on. Very educational and a beautiful way to get to know this part of Chiapas. High cliffs,dramatic views,even a unique form of a Christmas tree formed in the rocks due to cascading waters. The canyon stays quite cool due to the steep mountains on either side. We started our tour at 11 and returned to the dock at one and then our tour took us for a lunch break in town. It was a great way to learn more about this area of Mexico. The entire tour was given in Spanish but that was no problem for my sister and I as we had just completed a Spanish review for two weeks in San Cristobal. The price is right for this tour and can be enjoyed by all members of the family except very small children or people who may have difficulty getting in and out of the lunches.

459152440.name: Great afternoon on the river
459152440.author: a TripAdvisor user
459152440.reviewBody: Bright sunny day n calm water and the promise of Crocodiles,Vultures and Howler monkeys while afloat...what more can you ask. The trip takes a couple of hours in sturdy fiber glass boats with powerful out boards,we could not decides if all the wild life were on the payroll but everything turned up as we slowed,even the Howlers were on Cue.\nTry this,the canon de Sumidero is fun and has a terrible history of ancient suicide...that aside,go see.

456999396.name: Amazing place
456999396.author: a TripAdvisor user
456999396.reviewBody:
The place is fantastic. To get there I went to Chiapa de Corzo and there my father and me bought tickets to get to the Cañon den sumidero, it was very cheap like $260 MNX it's like 13$ USD the name of the touristic reception it's  "Embarcadero Cahuere" the people there it's so friendly and servicial. 
The place is very nice I've had a good time I really enjoyed the tour. 
Recomendations: 
-Take sunscream 
-Don't forget your Sun glases 
- be carefully with you cam and cellphones 
- if you speak English or other language. Read about the place before to take the tour. (The guides don't speak English or other languages. So they explain all the tour in Spanish.)
-please... go to the toilet before. The tour takes like 2.5 hours. 

You will have a good time. The view is fantastic.

455527359.name: The Mexican Grand Canyon
455527359.author: a TripAdvisor user
455527359.reviewBody:
Unique geographic formation in Southern Mexico (Chiapas). Can be enjoyed from below (by boat) and from above (by car). There are day tours for each location, departing from Tuxtla Gutierrez (main city). Both visits are recommended. For the limited budgets (like me) though, those tours are kind of expensive, ranging between $75 and $120, per tour. This is what I did...

For the boat tour, there is a local bus stop in Tuxtla, between the 11th and 13th Streets (SW), right on Avenida Central Oeste. Take there a bus to Chiapa de Corzo. Ask the locals for the right bus number. The cost is: $.025 per ride. Get off at Chiapa de Corzo’s Main Plaza (takes about 20 minutes). On arrival walk towards the docks, looking for the Park’s Service Station, where you can buy a Park Access wristband for $2. Don't pay for a boat ride there (they will sell you out). Instead, look for boat services all the way to your right (facing the river). Look for boats color either blue or red. The more you walk to the right the cheaper. Those boats charge about $5 for a guided 2-hour ride. Super tip: If you are a fisherman (I am), for about $10 (well bargained) a local fisherman (you will see their boats all the way to the left) would take you fishing on the river, for half a day. You should buy the Park Access wristband anyway, if you want to do both things (fishing and touring). Return by bus, same way. Total fee: $11. DO NOT THROW AWAY THE WRISTBAND (you can use it to enter the Park, the next day, for free). If you arrive early in the morning at the docks, you may have time to visit the nearby waterfalls. There are day tours for hire at the Main Plaza, off the docks.

For the Cliffs (next day). Take a public, shared taxi ("pecera"), on Avenida Oriente Norte (between Avenues 2a y 3a (NW)). It will take you, in about 20 minutes, right to the Park entrance (on the mountain side). Ask the locals, or the driver, for the right car number. The Cost is $0.75, per ride. Super tip: At the gate, ask anyone driving into the park for a lift (the Park rangers would not let you just walk in). Get straight to the top (most visitors go there anyway), so you can visit all the trails in your way down (easier). This is a half day visit. There is plenty of wildlife to watch. Total cost $1.50.

The views from below, and the top, are impressive. And the price is right!

455337745.name: Amazing place
455337745.author: a TripAdvisor user
455337745.reviewBody: Stunning place - do not miss doing a boat ride through the canyon! The only reason I rated 4 instead of 5 is because of the litter. This however seems to drift to a particular area so not spread throughout the canyon. Other than that,  this place is visually spectacular - combines the majesty of Yosemite with the beauty and serenity of Halong Bay.

453718333.name: A must see
453718333.author: a TripAdvisor user
453718333.reviewBody: Scenery was amazing. The guides were very i formative. The little kids did fall asleep and got bored but everyone thoroughly enjoyed the entire tour. You get a water taxi that comes and you can buy refreshments and snacks.

448406512.name: More people should see this
448406512.author: a TripAdvisor user
448406512.reviewBody: We orginally were going to do the boat tour one in our party got ill and wasn\'t to being on the water, so we opted to drive this scenic road that takes you to five scenic lookout points. Four are right on the road one requires a 700m walk on a gravel path. At the start of the road you pay an entry fee and then it is a narrow windy drive with excellent views of the sprawlingTuxtla. I\'m surprised how few people visit this place. At the time it was just us and a couple driving up the road, the views are stunning with the last view of the bend in the canyon mind blowing. This is probably one of the best drives in Mexico. I would recommend bringing binoculars it is great viewing all the activity in the canyon.

439148470.name: Great views of the Canyon
439148470.author: a TripAdvisor user
439148470.reviewBody: This is a must see in Tuxtla. Although the drive is through winding roads and a bit tiring, the end result is worth it. The views from the viewing deck are just spectacular. Not much to say. A must see for any visitor but definitely a must see for the photographers out there.

431633336.name: Well worth it
431633336.author: a TripAdvisor user
431633336.reviewBody: Beautiful canyon, lots to see including huge crocodiles, great price around 90 pesos for about 2 hours up the river.

416499737.name: Must visit this Canyon from above and below
416499737.author: a TripAdvisor user
416499737.reviewBody: This National Park appears to be little known outside of Chiapas.  You have 2 options when visiting the area.  You can drive up to the midadores which are 5 high look out points with amazing views of the river or you can take a 2 hour guided boat ride through the Canyon.  I recommend doing both. On my last trip we drove up the mountain to the well maintained look out points with amazing views in the morning and then had lunch in Tuxla G.  After lunch we boarded the near by tour boats.  I enjoyed pulling right up to the resting crocodiles on the bank of the river .  The whole slow paced day trip took about 7 hours from San Cristobal .  We utilized a guide service .  Don\'t go all the way to San Cristobal and miss this National Park.

411703725.name: Start from top
411703725.author: a TripAdvisor user
411703725.reviewBody:
This place is a Must-see for anyone visiting Chiapas. Many people take the boat tour to the Canyon but not the "Miradores". They don't know what they are missing!

The sights from the observation points are breathtaking. You can easily spend a full day on this tour if you wish, but if your time is limited, then start with the highest observation point, which is the best place to see the Canyon, and stay there as long as you wish.  

The tourist services in the area are limited, though. Also, be ready for the chilling weather. Also, sometimes  it might get windy or cloudy, the experience is worth the try, anyway.

Enjoy!

411635056.name: Amazing
411635056.author: a TripAdvisor user
411635056.reviewBody: This is not to be missed if you are in Chiapas. The scale of the canon is impressive and for 190 pesos you get 2-2:30 hrs in a boat down the canon seeing wildlife such as monkeys, alligators and Pelicans. Highly recommend!

410140401.name: Amazing natural view!
410140401.author: a TripAdvisor user
410140401.reviewBody: No more to say   about  it..    you  must to see   that\u00b4s it!..\n\nThe only tip:  buy  your  ticket   directly  with  the boat cashier company and  go  early,  wear hat, carry water o beer  is permited..  and  anjoy  de boat travel!

398997533.name: Very awesome place
398997533.author: a TripAdvisor user
398997533.reviewBody: I recommend this trip for sure. Only 190 peso for a 2 hour ride down the river and the views are just fabulous. The boat goes pretty fast to so its really fun

398643932.name: Worth a flight to Tuxtla all by itself
398643932.author: a TripAdvisor user
398643932.reviewBody: I find it strange that this canyon is not on the first place of attractions of Tuxtla since this certainly is one of the the main atractions of Chiapas. Taking the boat tour  through this canyon is an incredible experience. The crocodiles and many beautiful birds are very special. But the 1200 meter walls of the canyon are most impressive. Many tours include a drive into miradores of the Sumidero natural park to visit some of the highest view points, this is highly recommended but the boat trip should be priority. And then after the boat trip go for lunch in one of the many cute restaurants in Chiapa de Corzo which are unfortunately not listed in Tripadvisor. The local fish from the river is very good.

397429723.name: Pictures can\'t get the true beauty of this!!!
397429723.author: a TripAdvisor user
397429723.reviewBody: You can walk on the trails to have a great view from the top, or take a boat tour and see the esplendor and fauna of this awesome place, we did the boat trip!!!

397157601.name: Stunning vistas-but beware non Engkish speaking guides
397157601.author: a TripAdvisor user
397157601.reviewBody: This magnificent gorge close to San Cristobal de las Casas is a must see if you have the time. Sheer rock faces, twisting gorges, turkey vultures, crocodiles and spider monkeys chattering overhead all add to the exotic adventure. Make sure you bring water & snacks - the places are all totally average to buy stuff from. One word of warning - we booked our canyon boat in San Cristobal and were assured the boat guide would speak English - he didn\'t - not one word. Now, my Spanish is fine for conversation, bars, bus stations etc, but not for fauna and flora!! Luckily for us we had a German lady who spoke fluent Spanish and had to translate for the 20 people on board......the guide even then had the cheek to ask for a tip at the end for his information!!

394051662.name: The boat trip is well worth it!
394051662.author: a TripAdvisor user
394051662.reviewBody: Unfortunately we didn\'t make it up to the miradores but we took the boat trip through the Ca\u00f1on which was incredible. The boat trip starts just outside of Chiapa de Corzo. It was about $200 pesos per person but I felt it was a good price for a 2 hour trip along a spectacular ca\u00f1on. Our guile explained everything to us and showed us crocodiles and even some little baby ones. They expect a tip at the end. We were a little over generous as we had to go first but most people put in loose change and some nothing at all. It\'s also very hot there compared to San Cristobal so be prepared. The ca\u00f1on is unmissable though. I\'d highly recommend it!

393054275.name: Boat tour
393054275.author: a TripAdvisor user
393054275.reviewBody: We did a boat tour of the Canon and it is amazing. Take some pesos as there is a snack boat at the turn around area. You will be thirsty. Crocodiles, birds and waterfalls. Our 10 year old loved the boat tour

384113132.name: Not for the faint hearted
384113132.author: a TripAdvisor user
384113132.reviewBody: The canyon is as amazing from above as it is from below but beware  it\'s pretty high up. We drove up on a foggy morning and after we paid our entry fee to the national park we drove up and up and up. We were told by the ranger that lookouts 2 and 4 were the most breath-taking and suitable for easy access. We got to number 2 and were welcomed by a sea of white! We couldn\'t see a thing, too misty! But after 10 mins it cleared up and the view was well worth the shot in the dark (no pun intended). We found the lookout railings to be a bit short (about a meter) and behind it just a long drop. Not an ideal place to let your kids roam free. Or let your guard down whilst leaning over to have a look. Amazing views and beautiful photo opportunities but remember be safe!!

378595195.name: Incredible!
378595195.author: a TripAdvisor user
378595195.reviewBody: This is a fantastic place to visit. Nature is overwhelming. Private tours are pretty expensive but you can find group tours for less than 200 for two hours.

377063776.name: Dizzying heights; infinite views
377063776.author: a TripAdvisor user
377063776.reviewBody: Cool off on a weekend with a trip to the Miradores (Look-out points) above the Sumidero Canyon.  The park is located on the edge of Tuxtla (best to go by car) and features a series of look-out points where you can observe the canyon from its beginning to its highest point.  In each of these look-out points there is a parking lot and a path to the edge of the canyon--some of the paths are very short, some of them are around half a mile long, through tropical woods. The views are impressive, overlooking the Grijalva River with its boats, the sheer cliffs on the opposite side of the canyon, the mountains behind and the buzzards circling in the vast, empty air between the canyon walls.  Closer to hand you can see butterflies, dragon flies and other insects, and hear the songs of many different birds.  At the highest point there is a restaurant and restrooms, as well as a look-out platform that can cause dizzy spells in the most daring viewers.

373588165.name: Simply beautiful
373588165.author: a TripAdvisor user
373588165.reviewBody: The 2 hour canyon and river trip shouldn\'t be missed while in the Tuxtla area.  Besides the awesome cliffs and views, you\'ll see spider monkeys, egrets, thousands of Cormorans, alligators, and other wildlife throughout your trip.

367649689.name: A thrilling boat ride
367649689.author: a TripAdvisor user
367649689.reviewBody: The view from the lookout points of the canyon are great, but the fast boat ride up the Rio Grijalva into the canyon was exciting.  After lining up to get our life jackets fitted, we boarded the boat for a fast run up the river.  The boat slowed down or stopped when interesting fauna (crocodiles, buzzards, monkeys) were spotted.  There were also so other interesting formations of the rock walls that form the canyon.  The ride was a couple of hours long and relatively inexpensive.

361335848.name: Amazing view, it is a recommended destination
361335848.author: a TripAdvisor user
361335848.reviewBody:
This was my first trip to Tuxtla Gutierrez, and at first I thought the boats dock was near this place, wrong.
This place offers you 4 magnificent views of the Canyon, it is a 23km trail you can drive through.
The last stop has a rest area with a small fossil museum and restrooms.
The prices is less than 2USD per person (adults and kid +6) and it is discounted at the boat tour.

358043744.name: Just beautiful
358043744.author: a TripAdvisor user
358043744.reviewBody: You can drive and watch the canyon at the view points and then ride the canyon by boat.  A two hour ride

357060605.name: Breathtaking views
357060605.author: a TripAdvisor user
357060605.reviewBody: Before we went to Tuxtla Guti\u00e9rrez to take the boat and see the river, we went up to the Miradores of the national park to see the river from above... what an experience! The views were absolutetly breathtaking. The temperature is -5 degrees lower than in the city, so the trip worth the money

659647713.name: Broken down
659647713.author: a TripAdvisor user
659647713.reviewBody: I came here because everyone was telling me I should visit and I left heartbroken.  The animals are being held in very small enclosures and they didn\'t seem healthy at all.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

641872329.name: Great place with lots of species living in their natural habitat
641872329.author: a TripAdvisor user
641872329.reviewBody:
Its a great place where animales
live inside of their natural habitat.
Saw a review where they talk about spiders.. well I never saw one in my almost 3 hr walk.

Place isnt Sea World or so ... so dont expect the place to be that friendly for people with any kind leg issues or walking impairment... as some paths arent flat.. so you will do some exercise there.
Also.. as its not Sea World you wont find staff supervising people... or guiding them ...and well u will find most of visitors with a lack of education treating the animals like if they were dogs (whistling at them trying to get them near and silly stuff like that)
Stuff like this you will find a lot... but just ignore that and enjoy the view.

Its very well organized with signals as they marked a path with animal paws to guide you... 
of all the animals i was amazed
to see was the quetzal.. coralillo snake.. and jaguars! 
Black Jaguar (Panther) likes to walk around near where people is watching so we had an amazing view.

Place also needs a little bit of maintenance.. some windows where kinda dusty so it also makes some animals hard to see.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

618329497.name: Family
618329497.author: a TripAdvisor user
618329497.reviewBody: I loved this zoo for two main reasons. The first is that for the most part the animals live in naturalistic enclosures, not cages [yes, this did occasionally prevent me from seeing some animals]. The second was that I enjoyed watching human animals, i.e. Mexican extended families, in their natural habitat.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

617827483.name: Great place but spider scary!
617827483.author: a TripAdvisor user
617827483.reviewBody: This was a spare of the moment visit as the sumidero was closed as it was Tuesday. A great three hours of walking around looking at the well cared for animals. But! A word of advice if you have a spider phobia. They are everywhere. I am amazed no one has mentioned it in any other review. Unfortunately this tainted my visit as there were huge spiders hanging in webs everywhere you look. Yes I\u2019m in the jungle, no I don\u2019t expect them to fumigate. It\u2019s just I wasn\u2019t ready for it and actually cried :)  but no one\u2019s fault, at one with nature and all!

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

611031470.name: One of a kind zoo within a natural reserce
611031470.author: a TripAdvisor user
611031470.reviewBody: You\'l find only state fauna within a beautiful nature reserve. Enclosures tend to be all natural and allow you to see the animals within a setting that is very close to their natural home

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

539812212.name: What a Zoo Should Be
539812212.author: a TripAdvisor user
539812212.reviewBody: Huge enclosures here, from many of which the animals could seemingly come and go.  Natural setting and foliage ensures cool temps in warm weather.  The founder\'s love and attention is obvious to those who visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

494907711.name: Great zoo experience and one of the highlights of Tuxtla
494907711.author: a TripAdvisor user
494907711.reviewBody: The zoo is highly prized by the citizens of Tuxtla. The zoo is kind of basic but you do get to see some local animals. I am not a fan of zoo\'s in particular but certainly would recommend it to somebody that has a few hours to spare in Tuxtla. I would not go out of my way to go see it though, lots of wilderness around to experience some of those animals in their native habitat.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

476525846.name: Local wildlife
476525846.author: a TripAdvisor user
476525846.reviewBody: This is a 2.5KM walking zoo at Tuxtla Gutierrez, good for an afternoon with the kids, but consider wildlife for the zoo is focus on local animals, so it might be something different and interesting, but nature is also something to appreciate.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

456995587.name: Totally different
456995587.author: a TripAdvisor user
456995587.reviewBody:
Normally the things you wait to see in a zoo are the elephants, rhinoceros, giraffes and that kind of animals. This zoo it's very differen that others here don't exist that animals but exist the local animals. 
The ZooMAT it's the perfect place to enjoy all the fauna of the state of Chiapas, Manuel Alvarez del Toro is the man who start with this project to investigate, learn and teach the local people abpu the importance to take care of the nature. 
In my opinion the place is very nice and I have had a very good time with my father. This it's a place for all the family and you can enjoy the animals while you walk in the jungle and the mountains. 
Also the place has toilets, a store, restaurant, a play to keep your backpack (for free), and different places inside to make a picnic.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

425536337.name: The best zoo I\'ve ever seen.
425536337.author: a TripAdvisor user
425536337.reviewBody: It said in the guide book that this was worth \'half a day\'. I didn\'t want to leave at all having spent all day there. What the visitor has to realise is that the founder, seing the way things wre going even in the 1940s, has preserved species which are indiginous to this Mexican state only. So don\'t expect giraffes and tigers. Let yourself wallow in the tranquility. Forget the camera, the smart--phone and just BE! Even before you get to the pay-booth, monkeys swing about in the trees and agoutis snuffle about in the undergrowth. We are all in such a hurry and need instant pleasure every minute. Take your time quietly and experience the message of this place. Try not to get depressed that had it not been for the founder, we would not get a picture of what it used to be like before we all needed instant gratification. You may even find yourself here!

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

419977606.name: nothing too exciting
419977606.author: a TripAdvisor user
419977606.reviewBody: this was just your typical zoo, nothing too exciting or noteworthy.  entrance was free the day that i went :)

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

406773258.name: Best zoo in Mexico
406773258.author: a TripAdvisor user
406773258.reviewBody: This is one of the best zoos I\'ve attended. Exhibitions centralize on the local Chiapas fauna. Setting is gorgeous and animals roam free in their exhibit space. Some of the them such as deer, monkey and guaqueques (rodent type mammals) roam free. Great for kids and cost is only 10 pesos! A no miss if you go to Tuxtla

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

394379765.name: Great Visit to Tuxtla Zoo
394379765.author: a TripAdvisor user
394379765.reviewBody:
This was our second visit to Tuxtla Zoo and is a great place to spend a few hours wandering around the shaded paths.  There are numerous animals to see and the Zoo appears well maintained.  Entry costs are low and is perfect for the whole family. 

There are a number of places to purchase food or you can take your own and have a picnic at one of the many benches located around the Zoo.

We cannot wait to go back next time we visit Chiapas.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

391728152.name: Don\'t miss!
391728152.author: a TripAdvisor user
391728152.reviewBody: We took our children to this zoo on a very hot summer day and it was a great experience!. The dense foliage provides relief from the Chiapas heat as well as creating a tropical oasis in the middle of a huge city. I really forgot that I was in an urban center while visiting this zoo. We come from San Diego, which has a world class zoo, so I rarely visit other zoos while traveling, but the allure of ZooMAT is that all the animals are specific to the region. Some animals are free-roaming, which was fun for the children. There are  lot of smaller exhibits along with big, natural enclosures for the larger animals. It definitely feels like you\'re walking through their natural habitat. We were excited to see animals we\'d only previously seen on TV :) My personal favorites were the coatimundi and the tapir. This is definitely a must-see while in Tuxtla!

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

381162207.name: Nice Walk!
381162207.author: a TripAdvisor user
381162207.reviewBody: What i like most about this Zoo is walking in the shadow of the great vegetation we found there.  The Zoo is a nice place to visit only if you have enough time on your trip.  A Zoo is a zoo even tough the particularity of this one is that they only have animals from Chiapas.  It\'s not a big modern Zoo.  So conclusion if you have free time during your trip of if you\'re a huge animal lover the Zoomat is a really nice place to past 2-3 hours.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

377044311.name: Animals, trees, water and humans: perfect combination for a hot day!
377044311.author: a TripAdvisor user
377044311.reviewBody:
The one spot in tropical Tuxtla that is always refreshing is the ZOOMAT. Dense foliage above from enormous old trees, and many little streams, ponds and waterfalls around the paths, provide a delightfully cool microclimate.  In addition to all the featured animals of Chiapas in their enclosures, a myriad of wild animals: deer, howler monkeys, great curassow birds (like wild pheasants) and agouties (guinea pig-like rodents the size of chihuahua dogs), have decided to make this zoo their hang-out. If you go in the late afternoon you will often encounter herds of deer ambling about the walkways as the howler monkeys roar overhead. 
While some of the animals seem to have insufficient space to move about, most of them roam freely between rocks, trees and ponds in large enclosures. The otter (nutria) is a treat to see as it leaps and cavorts in its pond.  There is a special viewing area where you can sit and watch it from below the surface of the water. This otter obviously enjoys showing off for its human audience--I only wish it had a mate, as well. 
The information written outside the enclosures, in English and Spanish, is fascinating but unfortunately many of the signs are missing or misplaced. Still, they teach you a lot and prick your curiosity to go search Google for the missing details. 
This place is absolutely Tuxtla's best defense against global warming, and if you still have energy after you stroll all around the grounds for a couple of hours, the Ecological Reserve El Zapotal is right next to the zoo, with more waterfalls and swimming holes in the rainy season under the enormous native trees.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

358042976.name: Nice zoo, good for families with children
358042976.author: a TripAdvisor user
358042976.reviewBody: Nice walk through wooded area. We enjoyed it a lot. Good size,  you can see it in a couple of hours, small stores through out, clean restrooms\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

349750776.name: Pleasant shady spot!
349750776.author: a TripAdvisor user
349750776.reviewBody: Most animals (all are indigenous to Chiapas) housed in as close to natural habitat as possible for the space and appear well cared for.  Very cheap admission and a nice stroll through shady grounds with hills, streams, etc.- very pretty setting. Food and beverages are available.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

348011954.name: Great Zoo
348011954.author: a TripAdvisor user
348011954.reviewBody: Really nice scenery, had a very relaxed atmosphere and was really clean. You could tell that the animals and the place was really looked after well. Worth a visit!

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

339773279.name: One of the greatest zoo in Mexico
339773279.author: a TripAdvisor user
339773279.reviewBody: The zoo shows only local fauna in the closest way to their natural habitat.  Plan for a four hours visit.  I recommend the afternoon in order to avoid the heat and see the animals become more active as the sun comes down.  Use a lot of repellent!

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

339022933.name: Great zoo - loved the play!
339022933.author: a TripAdvisor user
339022933.reviewBody: What an interesting zoo! Only has local animals - nothing imported. I love that. While in some places a big run down, makes up for it in interest, closeness to animals and a feel being something "other than a zoo". I saw the Guardians of the Mist play - which was totally wonderful!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

330029905.name: Very good
330029905.author: a TripAdvisor user
330029905.reviewBody: Well worth the visit.  Could spend hours and hours there.  Quite amazed by variety of animals and well kept.  I went there mainly to see Quetzales but what happened to their tail feathers ?  Somebody already plucked them ?  do they grow back ?

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

328590155.name: Extraordinary experience
328590155.author: a TripAdvisor user
328590155.reviewBody: This was one of the best zoo experiences in my life. The setting is superb as the animals are literally in the middle of the jungle. Monkeys roam freely around you are you walk. The only downside is that the visit involves a lot of walking so if you visit with someone that is handicapped you will not enjoy as much.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

306303418.name: Epic Zoo!
306303418.author: a TripAdvisor user
306303418.reviewBody:
The Zoo was epic, and absolutely worth a visit! Here are the reasons:

- Nice scenery, seemed almost like a national park
- Great way to learn about what kind of wilderlife moves in Chiapas
- Many empolyees to answer your questions
- Very big, many animals, and they were also quite easy to spot.
- Very cheap. Like 20 pesos.
- Well maintained

Most important: The animals seemed to enjoy the place as well, and were well taken care of

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

295368625.name: I am not the zoo type...
295368625.author: a TripAdvisor user
295368625.reviewBody: As the title states- I am not the zoo type at all. I have been to a few notable ones but will never go out of the way to go to a zoo. I was with my family, they wanted to go, so we went. As you can tell, I wasn\u00b4t overwhelmed with excitement.. However, to my surprise this place is fantastic!\n\nThe zoo is clean, well run, and the animals are healthy and seem happy. I was amazed by the black panther and jaguar display. We went on Sunday and it was free! If you\u00b4re nearby this is definitely worth the quick trip!

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

293731588.name: Lovely zoo in a forest setting
293731588.author: a TripAdvisor user
293731588.reviewBody:
We definitely recommend visiting this zoo, it's situated in a peaceful and shady forest and has a wide variety of animals and birds mostly from Chiapas. It's closed on Mondays so don't make the mistake we did and have to return on a different day. Tuesdays however are free! So it worked out well for us anyway. 

The zoo is medium sized with well laid out concrete paths for good access. You could see it in and hour and a half if you rush but taking your time you could also spend a majority of the day, it depends on your zoo visiting style.

We arrived at opening which is 8.30am and are glad we did as being school summer holidays the place filled up fast. Arriving at this time we were ahead of the craziness and the whole place was quiet and peaceful with some of the deer, pheasants and other 'free' animals roaming around. 

Standouts for us were the quetzal which is absolutely stunning and the jaguars. A nice surprise was how clean the zoo was, not one piece of litter to be seen. We felt that the animal enclosures seemed to be a generous size as well.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

265562187.name: Called Best zoo in Latin America and the name is well deserved!
265562187.author: a TripAdvisor user
265562187.reviewBody: Not only is this zoo well conceived and laid out, but it is nestled into a hillside with lots of native birds to be found, chachalacas, guan, cura\u00e7ao, motmots and also native agouti running about.  In addition it sits under lovely shade trees, which is ideal in this tropical climate.  Don\'t miss this lovely place.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

244470228.name: A "must see"
244470228.author: a TripAdvisor user
244470228.reviewBody: This is a TG "must see." It features large enclosures for most of the animals. I went on a Sunday and of equal interest were the large, multi-generational family groups enjoying the zoo together.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

242257791.name: Bored animals in cages!
242257791.author: a TripAdvisor user
242257791.reviewBody: I really oppose to zoos, how would you like to be captured to be placed in a cage for the rest of your life?\nI\'ve heard the Zoomat is one of the largest in Latin America, however, the cages are so small poor animals seem to be bored to death. \nAfricam Safari in Puebla, Mexico is really how Zoos should operate, freeing the animals in the park is the least you can do, but really a Zoo should be a place to protect animals, procreate them, teach them to survive and then free them.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

239178315.name: Great zoo experience!
239178315.author: a TripAdvisor user
239178315.reviewBody:
This zoo showcases Chiapas' fauna, but the way it does it makes all the difference.

You are in the middle of the actual jungle and animals are in their original habitat (unlike the San Diego Zoo) even a lot of species, including howler monkeys, deer and huge deer like rodents roam free, at first you actually believe they escaped, but no...
Even the mighty jaguars and cougars seem happy and very well fed, no animal shows or trainers, and that's good.

The entrance fee is minimal $20 pesos per person, the restrooms are clean and food service is available and inexpensive, what I didn't like was the souvenir shop, little selection and sort of high prices, just bought a couple of magnets.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

238167450.name: A zoo well worth a few hours visit
238167450.author: a TripAdvisor user
238167450.reviewBody: We spent one night in Tuxtla Gutierrez mainly to see the zoo and the Parque Marimba.  The zoo is well worth a visit.  No, it is not a reallly slick zoo such as you might find in the US such as in San Diego but this is part of its charm.  The setting is very natural with tons of beautiful, tall trees so you can spend much of your visit in a very comfortable shade, even if it might be hot in the city.  The exhibits are generally large and have a natural environment.   We saw jaguars, monkeys, guacamayas and other animals that are native to Chiapas.  We spent 3 or 4 hours there and were very pleased.  Some of it will be difficult for those in wheel chairs but otherwise but others should put this on your list of things to visit if you are in Chiapas.  I believe the cost is only $30 pesos.  A great bargain.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

234924830.name: Worth visiting
234924830.author: a TripAdvisor user
234924830.reviewBody: We just wanted to spent couple of hours before heading to our next stop,  we were amazed from the varieties and the well designed place, you actually going through  rain forest

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

229403023.name: Local fauna
229403023.author: a TripAdvisor user
229403023.reviewBody: Lovely little zoo. Unpretentious, no exotics from far-away lands. They intelligently have animals from the Chiapas region, so as a traveler, it was nice to see the animals I didn\'t get to  see on my jungle trek.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

225701438.name: Family fun, plus
225701438.author: a TripAdvisor user
225701438.reviewBody: This is a pretty amazing zoo, reputed to be the best in Central and South America. What really blew me away, however, was seeing three, four and even five generations of Tuxtla Gutierrez families enjoying their weekend there together. I think what I am saying is that Mexico\'s numero uno asset is the Mexicans themselves.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

214365554.name: Great destination for a family outing
214365554.author: a TripAdvisor user
214365554.reviewBody: We so enjoyed our morning there !! A lot of families were there, nice to see all the kids enjoying the experience. Have to say that we enjoyed as much as the kids, this is an excellent zoo

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

207940327.name: Best Zoo in Latin America, a MUST!!
207940327.author: a TripAdvisor user
207940327.reviewBody: This is not only a beautiful natural setting, but a respite for humans and animals alike. As we entered the site, we witnessed aguties running about like bouncing rabbits and deer walking across our path. I couldn\'t believe !t! It took us two and half hours to cover the space. For people who are not in shape it could take longer. It has paths for wheel chairs too. The zoo has animals that live naturally in the state of Chiapas. If you plan to travel further into Chiapas this is a great introduction. This is an enjoyable experience for people of all ages. Not to be missed!

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

201208297.name: Honest review
201208297.author: a TripAdvisor user
201208297.reviewBody: If you can tell the cashier you live in Chiapas. Keep it short. Like most things in Chiapas, if you are a tourist they will gladly charge you more.\nYes, I find this practice dishonest. For example, a tourist will pay more for taxi then a local person.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

198985937.name: Wonderful Exhibits.  Great experience.  Must visit.
198985937.author: a TripAdvisor user
198985937.reviewBody: If you are in the area you must come to the ZooMat.  The grounds are lush with double canopy vegetation.  We found lots of places to sit and relax along the way.  It would be difficult to bring a child in a stroller because it is built onto the side of a hill.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

198697356.name: Sunday family destination
198697356.author: a TripAdvisor user
198697356.reviewBody: Excellent zoo with lots of local spieces. As it was really hot day (38C), both Jaguars were sleeping in the shady corners and couldn\'t get a good view, but that\'s unavoidable. Lots of picknick tables and chairs, so great spot for families.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

190968171.name: A Great Surprise in Tuxtla
190968171.author: a TripAdvisor user
190968171.reviewBody: My family and I used Tuxtla as a starting point for our trip in Chiapas. We were very surprised at what a wonderful time we had at the Miguel Alvarez zoo. It is huge, well-kept and a great value. It is even free on Tuesdays, if you live in Mexico you can get a discount on other days with your kids\' school ids. One thing to note, it\'s closed on Mondays and closes at 4:00, I think the web site says it\'s open later. There are places to buy food and drinks. My children got tired after about 2 hours of walking. You may want to take a stroller for younger children. If you go during the rainy season or on a really hot day, make sure you take bug spray. The paths are shaded but I would imagine that it would be very hot during the spring and summer.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

189740801.name: What a Fun Afternoon!
189740801.author: a TripAdvisor user
189740801.reviewBody: The Zoomat is a great way to learn about the animals in the Chiapas area.  They have a beautiful setting for viewing the animals.  The jaguars are great!

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

189422888.name: A pleasant  atmosphere
189422888.author: a TripAdvisor user
189422888.reviewBody: Liked seeing the jaguar and puma.. But yet again am not a wild animal kept in captivity kinda guy .. :). :( \nNicely managed zoo

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

188154649.name: I am not a zoo person but I liked it.
188154649.author: a TripAdvisor user
188154649.reviewBody: You can take a collectivo from downtown Tuxtler to the zoo in about 10-15 minutes. The zoo was very well maintained and pretty large. Some animals moved around freely, including birds, deer, howler monkey, etc.\nIt is the best zoo I ever visited.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

178377360.name: What a Zoo should be anywhere in the world.
178377360.author: a TripAdvisor user
178377360.reviewBody: This zoo is dedicated to local fauna and Chiapas is one of the most biodiverse states of Mexico, and Mexico is one of the most biodiverse countries on Earth. It was designed to reproduce as close as possible the natural habitat of the displayed species so the animals move almost as if at home. It is located in a forest on top of a hill, full of local samples of flora. The jaguars, of course, as well as the quetzal are the highlights, among others.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

163927568.name: Worthwhile
163927568.author: a TripAdvisor user
163927568.reviewBody: This zoo displays much of the native fauna. Can walk along a tree covered path which helps with the heat. You can take a really good and close look at all the animals that are there. Very inexpensive admission fee. Only potential drawback is that you must so some moderate climbing. Overall, a worthwhile trip when in Tuxla Gutierrez.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

160573275.name: This is a very interesting Zoo!
160573275.author: a TripAdvisor user
160573275.reviewBody: Free admission, follow the path in a circular format while seeing the naturalized exhibits. There are different kinds of animals than I have seen in other zoos. Most of them are local to Chiapas. We got to see many howler monkeys climbing free in the treetops. This is a hilly area, so wear good walking shoes.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

157730059.name: A different type of Zoo
157730059.author: a TripAdvisor user
157730059.reviewBody: This zoo only exibits fauna typical of the region, no imported animals, but the best is the grounds where the animals are kept, vary likely to their natural habitat.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

157374699.name: visited lots of zoo\'s this ranks top 5
157374699.author: a TripAdvisor user
157374699.reviewBody: this zoo is amazing its cheap and you get in free with a student isic card. theres so many animals and lots or without cages which is great for the animals. its really something to see. also the food outside is great and they also have a nice little gidt shop!

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

156941665.name: if you go to Chiapas, suggested first step is to go to Zoomat
156941665.author: a TripAdvisor user
156941665.reviewBody: If you know the state of Chiapas, recommend that you first make a stop in Tuxtla Gutierrez, that you go to the State Zoo. So you can meet much of the state\'s wildlife. Take into consideration that you will not see here are the animals typical of all zoos in the world, is not it. Here only see the wildlife of the state of Chiapas, that makes a big difference because you can meet animals less known but no less important. If you like the diversity of this zoo is one way of getting to know Chiapas. Do not miss it. Then you and you must know other sites, but the Zoomat is first. With your contribution access payment, also aids the maintenance of the project for future generations.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

155269702.name: A pleasant surprise
155269702.author: a TripAdvisor user
155269702.reviewBody: Like several other reviewers, I don\'t go out of my way to visit a zoo.  We didn\'t even have our grandkids with us!  However, we spent close to four hours enjoying this fantastic place.  Be ready to do some uphill/downhill walking and remember to bring your camera.  The open concept allows for some excellent picture opportunities.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

154951735.name: Fanatastic!
154951735.author: a TripAdvisor user
154951735.reviewBody: The Zoo is set in the jungle so the grounds are beautiful and make for a very relaxing visit. Most animals have sufficiently large cages and all are well cared for. There are also wild animals that move through the park such as Black Howler monkeys. If, like us, Tuxtla was a stopover during a larger tour of Chiapas, this zoo is a must see as it primes you for the animals you will be looking for in the wild.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

149526144.name: Best zoo we\'ve been to and we are not zoo people
149526144.author: a TripAdvisor user
149526144.reviewBody: The fact that this zoo only has local animals and is so well run and organised makes it ideal. A great way to spend a day.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

148548823.name: Best zoo in Mexico
148548823.author: a TripAdvisor user
148548823.reviewBody: Zoo collection limited to animals from Chiapas, but an amazingly large and extensive range of species in a beautiful natural environment.  A must for all visitors to Chiapas.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

146565664.name: Great Natural Habitat Zoo
146565664.author: a TripAdvisor user
146565664.reviewBody: This zoo exhibits endemic fauna from Chiapas. You can see many different exotic and colorful birds, cats, mammals and reptiles; all of them displayed in huge spaces withing their natural environment. Make sure to bring comfortable clothing and shoes because the walk is long and the Zoo is located in small mountain, so you kind of have to climb a little. All the paths are clean and have both steps and ramps so expect to walk a lot, but definitely it worth it. Not only because of seeing the animals, but also because of getting to walk into a beautiful landscape.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

133887355.name: BAck again!
133887355.author: a TripAdvisor user
133887355.reviewBody: We went to the Zoo again last week, and loved it.  We found the paths alot better than last time and they were all marked with the way to go.  There were a couple of empty enclosures.  If you are goingto tuxtla, you HAVE to go here

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

122840822.name: Great way to learn about endemic species of Chiapas
122840822.author: a TripAdvisor user
122840822.reviewBody: I am not a ZOO person, but after reading about this ZOO I decided to give it a try.  I really liked it. The Zoo only houses species that are endemic to Chiapas, and it is a great way to see and learn about them.  Most of the animals were visible and seemed happy enough in their almost natural habitat, the wall/fence being the only difference.  The Zoo is in the forest, completely shaded and it\'s a nice 2 hour walk to see everything.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

121783527.name: Decent zoo but overhyped in LP
121783527.author: a TripAdvisor user
121783527.reviewBody: This is another one of those Lonely Planet headaches. They really hyped this place, even saying it was such a realistic natural setting that the writer said he was scared. I expected a zoo with a real nature reserve like vibe, so I went way out of my way to make it here, and it was just another zoo. Not great, not bad, but definitely not matching the LP text. It was annoying because I did this after Canon de Sumiero. A canon tour is 200 pesos roundtrip, but to do it solo costs 180 pesos plus another 100 pesos in collectivos. It\'s more expensive without the tour. I did this just to go to Zoomat, which ran about another 100 pesos in taxis and collectivos and 60 pesos to get in. So in other words, I really expected more. If you just want to see some cool panthers, jaguars, birds, snakes, etc., then it\'s cool, but it\'s definitely not a can\'t-miss experience. I really just suffered from over expectation cuz of LP, and I was bummed since it was such a pain to get there.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

116902403.name: Great zoo and I don\'t like zoos.
116902403.author: a TripAdvisor user
116902403.reviewBody: I hate the very idea of zoos and have since I was a child. There were four of us travelling together and the other three wanted to go there. I was very pleasantly surprised. This is not animals in cramped cages. On of the things that impressed me the most was that there were birds and monkeys that were just hanging around there of their own free will. The jaguars seemed healthy and interested in what was going on around them. I\'ve seen jaguars in other situations that looked like they were dying of boredom. \n\nThe animals here are all indigenous to Chiapas...no rhinos in the snow...and was a very good learning experience.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

76106516.name: Very enjoyable few hours with children
76106516.author: a TripAdvisor user
76106516.reviewBody: The zoo provides a great environment to appreciate the wildlife of Chiapas (not all of it in cages!). Our girls had a great time. Well worth a visit if you\'re in the area. The walk through takes about 3 hours.

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

66376214.name: Awesome place
66376214.author: a TripAdvisor user
66376214.reviewBody: If you have time in Tuxlta, you really shouldn\'t miss a trip to the zoo!  It is a great place for all ages, and well worth the visit!

address.streetAddress: Calle Senor del Pozo 242 Cerro Hueco

670973002.name: Nice little museum, but bring your Spanish
670973002.author: a TripAdvisor user
670973002.reviewBody: We visited this museum a few days ago.  I nice little museum in the building that previously housed a natural history museum (Now moved by the Regional Museum).  It does a nice job of telling the story of Chiapas coffee from it\'s start to the present day.  One thing to be warned, it\'s mostly in Spanish, so if you don\'t speak / read it bring a translator.  The website had said it was free when we checked, but they charge a small admission - which pretty much covers the cost of a cup of nice coffee, which they give you at the end.  A worthy outing in the dowtown area.

670724184.name: A great telling of the story or Chiapas coffee
670724184.author: a TripAdvisor user
670724184.reviewBody:
The museum is great, well laid out - and does a great job of telling the story of Chiapas coffee from inception to the present day.  There are a couple of important things to know:
1.  There is little English in here - you'll need your Spanish to really enjoy the displays.
2.  They give you a tabley PC at the entrance that can tell "some" of the story in English.  Bring some headphones as the audio from the speaker is weak even when turned all the way up.
3.  The website had the wrong hours and said the museum was free.  The hours are better than the website suggests, and the small cost is pretty much the cost of a good cup of coffee - and they give you a nice cup of coffee at the end.

653292280.name: A nice museum if you end up in tuxtla
653292280.author: a TripAdvisor user
653292280.reviewBody: Had to visit tuxtla for the day, and ended up visiting the cafe museum.\nVery nice museum showing about the history of the coffee and the process.\nLike most of Mexican museum, the info is mostly in spanish, but not to worry - I got Holkan as my English guide, so I ended up actually learning about coffee :)

541821172.name: History of Coffee
541821172.author: a TripAdvisor user
541821172.reviewBody: This small but charming museum is just off of the main plaza in downtown Tuxtla. You\'ll learn about how coffee first came to Mexico, how much us produced in various states, and even about coffee\'s health benefits. I was surprised to learn that despite being a large coffee producer and exporter, Mexico\'s per capita coffee consumption is actually rather low. Admission is 25 pesos, quite a bargain, and includes a cup of freshly brewed coffee, but a nice coffee shop on the premises would be a good idea.

188679244.name: Fantastic look at Coffee and its production in the state of Chiapas
188679244.author: a TripAdvisor user
188679244.reviewBody:
*as of 12/27, the museum is currently under restoration, please contact the museum before you visit**

I live in Tuxtla and I take all of my visitors to this museum.  Even if you don't love coffee, you can get a lot out of the experience.  The museum comes with a guided tour and a coffee tasting afterwards.  The guides are great - though depending on which one, you might need someone in your group to translate as not all speak English fluently.  The vast majority of the signs in the museum are in Spanish, but don't let this deter you.  They talk about the artisanal coffee process here in Chiapas, what makes the coffee here so special, and how coffee actually came to Mexico.  

If it's open when you're here, I highly recommend visiting this.  They also have movie nights and different events in their colonial style building (a rarity in Tuxtla).

Parking is a challenge, but if you are staying in the center of Tuxtla, you won't need it.  You'll be able to walk as it's conveniently located next to the main government plaza along the Avenida Central.

639295273.name: Beauti-falls
639295273.author: a TripAdvisor user
639295273.reviewBody: The trip to the waterfalls at Chiflon is a must see and do experience. Upon the short walk up to the main viewing point for the falls you will be impressed by a number of small falls and stunningly blue waters.

address.streetAddress: Ejido San Cristobalito s/n, San Cristobalito, 30110 Tzimol, Chis., Mexico Just off Highway 226

497779546.name: Day trip from Tuxtla to see the beautiful Chiflon Falls
497779546.author: a TripAdvisor user
497779546.reviewBody: About a 2 1/2 hour drive from Tuxtla just off highway 226 are the Chiflon waterfalls. Spectacular waterfalls and rapids, zipline, nice small restaurant - there are 2 entrances and each takes you up a different side of the falls. Bit of a hike up but lots of places  to rest and you can zipline down over part of the falls. We hired a guide - well worth it - works for a gratuity. We went off-season before vacation and during rainy season so the volume of water was huge. 3 larger falls and a series of rapids. The highest and final one you see is "Velo de Novia". If you take the first entrance (smaller on the north side) you will be standing at an observation deck right beside the falls (you will get wet). The southern (larger) entrance gives you views of the falls from across the river.

address.streetAddress: Ejido San Cristobalito s/n, San Cristobalito, 30110 Tzimol, Chis., Mexico Just off Highway 226

672331920.name: un lugar agradable para caminar y respirar aire mas puro
672331920.author: a TripAdvisor user
672331920.reviewBody: cuando visites en familia o con tu pareja o quiz\u00e1 hasta solo, no puedes dejar de dar un paseo donde sentir\u00e1s lo fresco de los aires del sur, un lugar que te dejara a gusto de caminar,correr y hasta jugar ,hacer algo de deporte para aquellos que suelen viajar y buscar un buen sitio donde salir a ejercitarse, \u00bfque tal para jugar con los ni\u00f1os? excelente, es un lugar limpio y seguro,agradable y los chicos lo van a a disfrutar mucho.

657859975.name: Excelente para correr o jugar basquetbol o futbol.
657859975.author: a TripAdvisor user
657859975.reviewBody: De mis lugares preferidos en Tuxtla para salir a correr, cualquier hora es buena ya que est\u00e1 lleno de \u00e1rboles as\u00ed que incluso puedes correr al medio d\u00eda en el fuerte calor de Tuxtla. Siempre hay personas jugando basquetbol as\u00ed que puedes armar tu "reta" sin problemas. El acceso es gratuito y para toda la familia.

653313126.name: Lugar muy agradable para el deporte
653313126.author: a TripAdvisor user
653313126.reviewBody: Las instalaciones permiten practicar casi todos los deportes y adem\u00e1s prepararse f\u00edsicamente para el acondicionamiento f\u00edsico, muy familiar

644362861.name: Ejercitarse
644362861.author: a TripAdvisor user
644362861.reviewBody: Es un lugar muy grande para poder hacer ejercicio al aire libre ya sea correr, jugar futbol, veisbol o front tenis igual puedes llegar a tener un picnic con tu familia

630480349.name: Excelente para ir con la familia a caminar o para hacer alg\u00fan deporte
630480349.author: a TripAdvisor user
630480349.reviewBody:
El parque Caña Hueca es una buena opción para ir a hacer algún tipo de ejercicio, en el puedes practicar diferentes deportes como basquetbol, fútbol, volleyball, tochito, ciclismo, atletismo y muchos más. Cuanta con dos pista para correr, una de 1 km si no estoy mal (está pista tiene el piso especia para carrera), y la grande que es de 1800 metros y es de concreto (o asfalto no estoy seguro).

El parque es muy concurrido, todas las mañanas hay muchas personas haciendo alguna actividad, hay estacionamiento y además pequeños puestos de comida, algunos venden alimentos saludables, el que está al lado del área de spinning siempre está abierto, las señoritas que ahí atienden preparan los mejores licuados pero lo mejor son los jugos de naranja natural 100% recomendable!!!

Es una lástima que el parque no se le de mantenimiento ya que hace un año estaba todo bien cuidado y lucia muevo, pero en este mes que volvimos (nov 2018) se ve muy deteriorado en especial los playgrounds and los botes de basura, es una lástima, ojalá que la próxima vez que vayamos se vea mejorado.

573825612.name: Motivaci\u00f3n al 100
573825612.author: a TripAdvisor user
573825612.reviewBody: un  parque familiar y excelente para ir con la familia a hacer ejercicio; adem\u00e1s que hay diversas actividades para realizar alg\u00fan deporte. Muy bien iluminado y alegre

551860935.name: Ideal para disfrutar\u2026
551860935.author: a TripAdvisor user
551860935.reviewBody:
Desde la caminata, hasta correr, o simplemete disfrutar con el ir y venir de la gente.
Yo llegue varias mañanas caminando desde el City Express hasta Cañahueca, disfruté de su ciclopista, de sus canchas de squash, futbol rápido, de los “runners”, y de los que disfrutan la caminata.
Ojo: No se permiten mascotas, ieal para todas las edades, se me hizo muy seguro para los niños. Los juegos muy bien cuidados y en buen  estado. Cada rinconcito es hermoso, debes tener cuidado si caminas con audifonos para no invadir la ciclopista, para no causar accidentes.
Cuenta con  un amplio estacionamiento. Es un Parque que invita a sentarse y disfrutar del paisaje, de la convivencia, y de uno mismo.
Me encanto que es un Parque “inclusivo”, descriptivo en  sus rutas y mapas de ubicación. 
Caña hueca, enamora. Y hasta para los citadinos que somos muy sedentarios, durante mis vacaciones no falté ni un solo día para disfrutar de un Parque verdaderamente hermoso!

525708616.name: Un buen lugar
525708616.author: a TripAdvisor user
525708616.reviewBody: Si gustan de hacer un poco de ejercicio este es el lugar , cuenta con una pista de 1,800 mts. campos de futbol , canchas de tenis y actividades al aire libre , yoga , zumba , etc..

672571498.name: Es visitar una imagen de Cristo mas grande que la que esta en Rio de Janeiro.
672571498.author: a TripAdvisor user
672571498.reviewBody: Visitar esta imagen de Cristo que esta localizada en el mirador de Copoya es algo unico, ya que,aparte de la vista que tienes de la ciudad de Toxtla Gutierrrez, la imagen en si es maravillosa y realmente te das cuenta de lo impactante e impresionante que es, ya que inclusive se puede ver desde cualquier parte de la ciudad, por estar en un cerro alrededor de la ciudad. Recomiendo visitarla y no perder la experiencia de la vista de la ciudad desde este punto.

636655739.name: PERFECTO PARA RELAJARSE
636655739.author: a TripAdvisor user
636655739.reviewBody: Acudimos durante la noche, el clima era fr\u00edo agradable, la vista es maravillosa. Puedes ver toda la ciudad!! Respiras frescura, escuchas a los grillos, disfrutas de la naturaleza y ciudad al mismo tiempo. En el lugar hay un restaurante en el cual nos tomamos un caf\u00e9, simplemente el lugar perfecto para ponerte al d\u00eda con tu familia o pasarla bien con tu pareja.

631544829.name: UN NVO AMANECER Y ATRADECER.
631544829.author: a TripAdvisor user
631544829.reviewBody: Aquiete su no nos gusta dr gracias por un nuevo d\u00eda? creo a todos por eso visitar el mirador de copoya te har\u00e1 vivir con tus propios ojos ese hermoso amanecer  o atardecer \u00fanico

625964122.name: Gran vista
625964122.author: a TripAdvisor user
625964122.reviewBody: Para llegar aqu\u00ed es f\u00e1cil, hay colectivos o la mejor opci\u00f3n es un taxi, cobran la entrada $10 por veh\u00edculo y el mirador queda justo frente al estacionamiento. La vista es realmente espectacular, se puede ver todo Tuxtla desde ah\u00ed, adem\u00e1s tienen misas los domingos para las personas que deseen asistir. Es una opci\u00f3n r\u00e1pida para visitar y vale mucho la pena llegar ah\u00ed arriba.

587244586.name: Imponente la cruz!
587244586.author: a TripAdvisor user
587244586.reviewBody: Han edificado en esta colina una cruz monumental muy hermosa. En su interior la copia del sudario de Tur\u00edn, la hermosa capilla con su mirador y el comparativo de los cristos monumentales del mundo hacen de este monumento el mas alto del mundo con 48 metros de altura.

540397036.name: Excelente vista
540397036.author: a TripAdvisor user
540397036.reviewBody: Terminar el d\u00eda en el Mirador de Copoya con una   Panor\u00e1mica vista al paisaje nocturno Tuxtleco, y disfrutar del fresco es un premio despu\u00e9s de caminar por la ciudad.\nCuenta con restaurante donde puedes probar platillos t\u00edpicos de la regi\u00f3n.

529745641.name: Excelente vista de la ciudad
529745641.author: a TripAdvisor user
529745641.reviewBody: La panoramica de la ciudad es muy completa alcanzandose a ver Chiapa de Corzo, la entrada al Ca\u00f1on del Sumidero, la Torres Chiapas entre otros puntos de interes. Regularmente la vista es como nebulosa

528095580.name: DOMINGO FAMILIAR
528095580.author: a TripAdvisor user
528095580.reviewBody: es una ruta muy bonita para pasar un domingo familiar, ya que puedes subir a escuchar misa, caminar por el poblado, desayunar o comer en los restaurantes que se encuentran alrededor.

512797358.name: Linda Vista
512797358.author: a TripAdvisor user
512797358.reviewBody: En la subida a la meseta de Copoya en la ciudad de Tuxtla Guti\u00e9rrez se encuentra este lindo mirador en el que tendr\u00e1s vistas muy bellas de la capital chiapaneca, buen viento y lugares para comer

501749901.name: ExcelentePara disfrutar de la vista y el clima fresco.
501749901.author: a TripAdvisor user
501749901.reviewBody: Si est\u00e1s en Tuxtla este es un lugar que no debes dejar de visitar, en especial por la tarde, cuando corre el fresco y comienza a atardecer, ver\u00e1s las m\u00e1s incre\u00edbles puestas de sol y puedes tomar o comer algo en alguno de los lugares que ah\u00ed est\u00e1n.

662335158.name: Teen and toddler
662335158.author: a TripAdvisor user
662335158.reviewBody: It\u2019s just a spot to take an Instagram picture. My teen daughter took her picture, nothing to see for my toddler \nThe only good thing is the clothing we bought and the pozol we drank near there

660352167.name: Magic place!
660352167.author: a TripAdvisor user
660352167.reviewBody: You\u2019ll find a lot of history in every corner. People is kind and all the food is tasty! I do recommend visiting the Central Park (and its fountain) and the Malec\u00f3n to watch the sunset over the river. Use some sunblocker! \ud83e\udd75\ud83c\udf1e\ud83d\udd25

659643232.name: clean
659643232.author: a TripAdvisor user
659643232.reviewBody: I came for the Ca\u00f1on del sumidero and its alright.  There are many shops around the square where you can buy your typical souvenirs.  A block from the main square is a street with food vendors, and the food there is the authentic food of Chiapa de corzo.

648307156.name: Amazing cultural town in Chiapas!!!
648307156.author: a TripAdvisor user
648307156.reviewBody: Such a beautiful town, full of culture!! We visited during a local festival, where we were lucky to witness many dancers in full cultural dress dancing and playong music all through the town. Followed by an incredible local market full of all handmade items, and a wonderful evening fair. Complete with sunset festival!!! A beautiful little town to say the least!

632034659.name: Posol and food
632034659.author: a TripAdvisor user
632034659.reviewBody: Visit this place and try the posol on the side of the second church where a market is. Check pictures for reference. The best Posol you will get on Chiapas. Tale some pictures on the famous fountain and eat at the restaurant los jardines, really good food!!

618329852.name: "Objection!"
618329852.author: a TripAdvisor user
618329852.reviewBody: Chiapas de Corza, while a lovely town and the gateway to the Ca\u00f1on Sumidoro, is not in Tuxtla Gutierrez. It\'s miles away, but worthvisiting.
