605069664.name: Nice place
605069664.author: a TripAdvisor user
605069664.reviewBody: This was a nice place to visit and walk in the park. They are doing repairs on the site but still, you enjoy the site and take plenty of photos. Also go down to the river and walk along the banks.

603535042.name: The gateway to your river trip at Sumidero Canyon !!!
603535042.author: a TripAdvisor user
603535042.reviewBody: Yes, this is where it all starts to see the market places and get a tour for Sumidero Canyon. We got here on a Sunday afternoon and it was nice to see how easy it was to arrange a tour of the canyon. We shopped a little and we saw some German backpackers who gave us directions to the coffee market where I bought some delicious Chiapan coffee-great for breakfast. There are places to eat and buy some nice "Parachico" wooden masks which are used during ceremonial dances. This is the place to visit just outside of Tuxtla when you want a little change, hear some marimba music, or get on a tour of Sumidero Canyon.

581262708.name: Part of our organised Ca\u00f1on tour
581262708.author: a TripAdvisor user
581262708.reviewBody: Our guide dropped us of in Chiapa de Corzo for lunch after our tour through Ca\u00f1on del Sumidero. We didn\u2019t find anything interesting to see or do. Also none of the restaurant reviews appealed much to us so we decided to follow a Foursquare traveller\u2018s advise and had a lunch snack at the Mercado P\u00fablico Municipal. The empanadas we got at one of the stands there were really good. Looking for a decent coffee afterwards Google Maps led us to iCaf\u00e9 Gourmet. The coffee was really good as well and we could sit there and watch the crowds passing by on 5 de febrero.

573827653.name: Great little town
573827653.author: a TripAdvisor user
573827653.reviewBody: We spent a few hours roaming around Chiapa de Corzo.  There are lots of cool shops, restaurants and other things to see.  If you are in the area you definitely need to come by and check it out.

569467738.name: Where al start
569467738.author: a TripAdvisor user
569467738.reviewBody: Beautiful arquitecture, you will find shopping souvenirs , food, and from here to embarcadero to take the boat to ca\u00f1\u00f3n del sumidero

568105087.name: Puebla Magica and good base for visiting the Ca\u00f1\u00f3n del Sumidero
568105087.author: a TripAdvisor user
568105087.reviewBody: If you find San Cristobal de la Casa too touristy, Chiapa de Corzo is the place for you: It has just recently become a Puebla Magica and has very few overnight tourists. There are a nice lievely central plaza and markt, faded streets to stroll, nice people, an archeological zone and some good hotel and restaurant options. It especially makes a good place to explore the Ca\u00f1\u00f3n del Sumidero because there are two jetties for the boat trips in town. To get here, take a bus to Tuxtla Guti\u00e9rrez and 20-30 minute taxi ride to Chiapa.

565626474.name: Sumidero canon on Chiapas land.
565626474.author: a TripAdvisor user
565626474.reviewBody: On our way to San Cristobal our group had stop for boat ride on Sumidero canon that is formed by Grijalva river and Chicoasen dam, there are few endangered species such as river crocks and spider monkeys. Boat tour lasts about two and half hours.

565163526.name: Nice park and community
565163526.author: a TripAdvisor user
565163526.reviewBody: We enjoyed the Canyon adventure and came to the town to have lunch. The riverside view is beautiful and so romantic. There are all kinds of nice places to take photos.

565087777.name: Fiesta time
565087777.author: a TripAdvisor user
565087777.reviewBody: We were so lucky to visit the first day of the 3 day annual fiesta (January 21-23) commemorating the defiant last stand by the local Indians against the Spanish Conquistadores. Several hundred apparently chucked themselves over the side of the Sumidero Canyon and into the river Grijalva rather than submit. What a fantastic sight met us, the streets were festooned with those lovely Mexican flags, there was an enormous market selling all sorts of locally handmade gifts and so many stalls etc selling food and drink. In addition all the local people were dressed in their beautiful embroidered garments which are commemorated on the entry to the town by the statue of a Chiapa de Corzo lady wearing her traditional dress. What noise, what fun, what excitement. It is difficult to say what it is like other days as it was so crowded we could only laugh and join in the fun. We could only see the outside of the local church which was built of brick and looked rather grand as it had been damaged by the September earthquake, I wonder if it survived the recent one?

557643336.name: Fiesta Grande was fantastic!
557643336.author: a TripAdvisor user
557643336.reviewBody: WE 3 American couples went to Chiapa de Corzo for the 1st time and had a wonderful experience during the last 2 days of the annual Fiesta Grande. Wow! So much fun and just 6 of very few "gringos" at the fiesta. Wet were treated so nicely by everyone and had a great time. We all decided we\'d like to go back and explore the town during non-profits tmes!

554006534.name: Charming town, a little overcrowded with tourists
554006534.author: a TripAdvisor user
554006534.reviewBody: Its a lovely stop-over on the way to San Cristobal from Tuxtla, the moorish architecture is stunning and they take care of it. Its similar to Tepoztlan with the markets and masses of tourists walking along.

550959853.name: Ca\u00f1\u00f3n del Sumidero. Gorgeous
550959853.author: a TripAdvisor user
550959853.reviewBody: Ca\u00f1\u00f3n del Sumidero in Chiapas de Corzo gorgeous place to visit! We took a boat to navigate along the Grijalva River, surrounded by the big and tall walls of rock. Magic place on earth!  To get there fly to to Tuxtla Guti\u00e9rrez Chiapas. Chiapas de Corzo is about 45 minutes from the airport. Then you can travel by car and sleep at San Cristobal de las Casas, beautiful mexican town.

544777978.name: iCafe
544777978.author: a TripAdvisor user
544777978.reviewBody: It\'s a nice little cafe with good coffee just near the church heading to the water. Calle 5 de Febrero #21. The staff are really welcoming and friendly. The bathroom is clean. They also sell and grind fresh beans.

505648506.name: Do it together with el ca\u00f1on del sumidero
505648506.author: a TripAdvisor user
505648506.reviewBody: You can do el ca\u00f1on in the morning and then Chiapa de Corzo in the afternoon. You have to be open minded to traditions and walk down the streets.

494985600.name: Short visit
494985600.author: a TripAdvisor user
494985600.reviewBody: There are a lot of stores to buy souvenirs. They are reasonable prices. This was the only place where I saw beautiful shoes that are hand painted.

485791717.name: Nice place to visit
485791717.author: a TripAdvisor user
485791717.reviewBody: We went to this town after visiting the Ca\u00f1on del Suridad. Quaint town to visit but nothing outstanding. The town square had a beautiful moorish building. The rest was your typical tourist area -- locals selling/begging to sell their wares. Nothing extra ordinary to see.

484783097.name: My trip to Chiapa de Corzo.
484783097.author: a TripAdvisor user
484783097.reviewBody: There is really nice people always willing to help.From there you can take the tour to El Ca\u00f1on del Sumidero.

476553900.name: Hot, beautiful.
476553900.author: a TripAdvisor user
476553900.reviewBody: Came to visit Ca\u00f1\u00f3n del Sumidero and the town square. During April the climate was hot and humid. Hat and sunscreen are a must. Ca\u00f1\u00f3n del sumidero needs no introduction and is something you can\'t miss. \nChapa de Corzo town square keeps the "Pila fountain" which is a very old and interesting landmark, right in front of los portales. There you can buy cheap crafts, including traditional clothing, jewelry, and candy. There is also the church of Santo Domingo, the most important building in town, that holds the biggest bells of the country. You can climb a narrow staircase that brings you to the top for 10 pesos.\nIt\'s quite safe to wander around.

471892002.name: A good start for a Trip to Chiapas
471892002.author: a TripAdvisor user
471892002.reviewBody: After many years wanting to visit the satate of Chiapas in M\u00e9xico, my wife and I, finally got away from our grandchidren and flew there, as starters we visited this interesting small town which is a suburb of Tuxtla Gutierrez and you can take a boat tour to the "Ca\u00f1on del Sumidero" the town itself is a great visit, we enjoyed walking through the local market, where you can purchase handcrafts from all around Chiapas, visit a church built in the 16th century and get an idea of what to expect from the multiple attractions to be found in this state, there are many other attractions close by, but i would recommend, if you are not accustomed to visitig mexican small towns that you take a tour in your hotel, if you are staying in Tuxtla Gutierrez.

471414858.name: The ancient Village of Chiapanecan people
471414858.author: a TripAdvisor user
471414858.reviewBody: When the spaniards came to Chiapas, the current town of Chiapa de Corzo was the biggest city in the region, the chiapanecas was a particular etnia who speaks zoktom an otomangue language, today almost extinct. Controlling the zoque and maya territory this place was an multicultural city with many resources taken from neighbors. Today is a beautiful and hot town with nice churches a lovely market where you must try pozol de cacao and cochito and is the gate and port to the sumidero canyon tour. there you can also visit the rest of the ruins of ancient chiapa.

463264491.name: Nice place
463264491.author: a TripAdvisor user
463264491.reviewBody: Visited during the Chiapa de Corzo yearly fiesta so the architecture was blocked off during the event but after it ended it was unblocked. Beautiful!

460548735.name: Great spot for lunch historical views. Cathedral shops and more
460548735.author: a TripAdvisor user
460548735.reviewBody: We stopped at this location for lunch after a tour of the canyon of Sumidor. Although it was hot, we were able to find a nice place for lunch and there is an arcade area where you can walk and be out of the sun. You can also have a view of the river from behind the church. Many different kinds of vendors and shops to visit. Some of the best handwork and cross stitch work on blouses I have seen during my entire visit. Don\'t forget to try some of the local ice cream, A must on a hot day.

456996768.name: Relax place
456996768.author: a TripAdvisor user
456996768.reviewBody: On my trip the first thing I decide to do was to go to the sumideros cannon. So to go there the first thing is to go to Chiaps de Corzo. I have to say the lil town is very quiet to be honest there are not a lot of things to do but you can have a very nice time to walk and enjoy the food, buy some handicrafts and the park in the center it haces haces get beautiful architecture very abstract and wonder to take some pictures.

456794455.name: Nice Small Town
456794455.author: a TripAdvisor user
456794455.reviewBody: Small Town, Nice Central Park Plaza with a great structure called La pila de Chiapa de Corzo from the S. XVI Century. It\'s also home of The Cahuare Pier, where you take the boats to Sumidero Canyon, so its worth a visit if you are taking this ride. There are some shops and restaurants around the plaza and pier. \n\n

454737243.name: Visiting the Feria San Sebastien
454737243.author: a TripAdvisor user
454737243.reviewBody:
At the invitation of a Mexican friend from Tuxtla, we visited the Feria San Sebastien on January 14, just before the "official" opening of this event that spans +|- 10 days in January and is the equivalent of a state fair. 

Many traditions surround the Feria San Sebastien and we did not get to see them all, but the town is very cute with its mix of old and modern, Spanish and Chiapean. The chapel dates to the 16th century as does the center feature of the zócalo, La Pila. Fascinating history lies here. 

We were too late for a tour of the Cañon, but it is a must-do activity. Just plan to arrive before 4pm when the final boat tour leaves. 

We ate at Comitán, right on the river. It was food and we tried an assortment of typical Chiapean fare. There was a chicken wandering around, which we joked was their way to keep the next meal fresh. This is obviously not a typical North American restaurant. 

The vendors all throughout the town have many offerings from the region: art and all kinds of souvenirs. During the feria, there was a bit of everything (even pots & pans and TV rabbit ears!!), as well as all kinds of fair food. 

Definitely a fun place to spend a day while in the Tuxtla area.

453917793.name: Attractive
453917793.author: a TripAdvisor user
453917793.reviewBody: Chiapa de Corzo is a small city close to Chiapas\' capital, Tuxtla Gutierrez. It\'s a beautiful town that holds the title of Pueblo M\u00e1gico. There are several attractions in town and in its surrounding - Ca\u00f1on del Sumidero being the most popular, but there\'s also the Fuente Colonial (Colonial Fountain). Walking on its streets and enjoying an evening at one of its parks makes it a nice and relaxing experience. Something no one will regret.

452945230.name: was okay but not sure why we were dropped here
452945230.author: a TripAdvisor user
452945230.reviewBody: WE did the Canon tour and then they dropped us off here for 1 hour and we werent too sure why.  WE had some lunch and walked around.  You can climb up to the top which was the only real highlight.\n\nI wouldnt rush here

452726476.name: The Old Tree is Important !
452726476.author: a TripAdvisor user
452726476.reviewBody: In Chiapa de Corzo, they talk about the crown, the one the spanish built to celebrate their conquest,.. but behind that crown is the tree,.. very old, very special,.. it was there before the conquest ! It deserves reverence.

451062385.name: A must see while in tuxtla
451062385.author: a TripAdvisor user
451062385.reviewBody: And go there especially early January for the chunta, parachicos. Great start for canyon sumedero too

450816769.name: Boring place
450816769.author: a TripAdvisor user
450816769.reviewBody: We visited Chiapa de Corzo during our trip to Canon del Sumidero. The place is told to be a typical traditionsl mexican village. To be honest it was very boring experience for us,there is almost nothing to do,except some local market sellers. Also it was very hot and stuffy there. 1 hour stop was too long for us.

449754985.name: Visit
449754985.author: a TripAdvisor user
449754985.reviewBody: This little town is a nice and full of history place in Chiapas. The central monument is incredible. All brick made. Crown shape. It is the place where you take the boat to the Sumidero Canyon

448759310.name: Cool
448759310.author: a TripAdvisor user
448759310.reviewBody: The place is nice and you can go around and have a relax and quiet day. People there are really nice and if you ask them for what to do or what they recommend to do they tell you and guide you with no problem. Amazing place.

448406857.name: Quaint and relaxing
448406857.author: a TripAdvisor user
448406857.reviewBody: There isn\'t much to do here, just chill and relax, the centre of town has some lovely architecture to admire, some places to eat, it is a good stop on a road trip.

436211658.name: We loved Chiapa de Corzo
436211658.author: a TripAdvisor user
436211658.reviewBody: If you are staying in San Cristobal, take the mini van taxis, located around the corner from the OCC bus station. Our ride to Tuxtla was easy and it cost 55 pesos. We loved Chiapa de Corzo, area near the River is fun. There are a few restaurants, choosing was difficult, so we chose the one that had Marimba music but the water. We walked around and enjoyed the town and the vendors. I was proud to say that I was able to purchase a one of a kind mask (made to order) from the Master Parachicos mask maker; Don Antonio Lopez Hernandez. I felt honored to be able to obtain a treasure like that, which I will cherish for years. Our tour guide on the Sumidero was a nice young man who showed us the canyon and advised us of the names of the birds, animals and surrounding history of the Sumidero Canyon. I would come back here in a heartbeat.

435888533.name: A pretty old town set upon a beautiful wide river
435888533.author: a TripAdvisor user
435888533.reviewBody: It is a great relief after leaving the filthy center of Tuxtla Guti\u00e9rrez to reach this small well-kept town.  Among the attractions:  just walking through the narrow streets; taking a look at the unusual crown-shaped mud\u00e9jar fountainin the square; taking the boat trip through the Sumidero canyon, which hopefully will have been cleaned of trash; catching a glimpse of crocodiles in the river;sipping a cool drink in one of the restaurants at riverside, where one catches a splendid view of the river and listening to the ubiquitous marimba music.  Also, one must eat in one or more of the many attractive restaurants.  Pepita with tasajo (beef jerky with squash seed), cochito (a pork stew in a tasty sauce) and stuffed peppers are local specialties.

432515472.name: Small nice town
432515472.author: a TripAdvisor user
432515472.reviewBody: This is a very small town and the attractions are buy typical things and eat (good not excellent) the church is fresh and very simple. We got here after the canon of sumidero and we were melting because the weather. The sun was heavy, and it was not my best mood. Next time I will have my gallon of water and my umbrella to cover the sun and enjoy the visit. Use walk shoes to be here.

431634438.name: Cute little town on the river
431634438.author: a TripAdvisor user
431634438.reviewBody: Nice walking around little town with pleasant square and craft area, a few nice restaurants and coffee shops along the street that deadends at the river from the square.  Take the tour of the canyon from the docks there, it is magnificent for about 90 pesos, 2 hours.  Several nice old churches.

418837523.name: Very picturesqe old city with a great attraction
418837523.author: a TripAdvisor user
418837523.reviewBody: We stopped in Chiapa de Corzo for one night on our way from the Tuxla Gutierrez Airport to San Crist\u00f3bal de las Casas in order to take an early morning boat tour of the Sumidero Canyon. No night life and few restaurants but a cute compact old city.  There\'s other things to do but the Sumidero Canyon river trip is worth the visit.

411634711.name: Only passed through
411634711.author: a TripAdvisor user
411634711.reviewBody: Seems like a really nice town of you want to avoid Tuxtla G and be closer to the canon. We only passed though but would have preferred staying here...

408477617.name: Always nice
408477617.author: a TripAdvisor user
408477617.reviewBody:
As long as the teachers don't take and  bloc the federal highway its fine.

It's amazing the Sumidero Tour one of the most beautiful sites.

Very sad to see how the teachers had kidnap the city, you can't walk safe, you always feel insecure and you can notice how the population is sick of them, and how they have destroyed the city, it's truly a shame.

Despite of that, it's beautiful and amazing.

405727261.name: MAGIC TOWN OF CHIAPAS
405727261.author: a TripAdvisor user
405727261.reviewBody: A nice town nearby Tuctla Gutierrez, lovely streets, emblematic architecture. You can find traditional handcrafts. Really nice place to visit

398997360.name: Nice day trip
398997360.author: a TripAdvisor user
398997360.reviewBody: I got a bus here from Tuxla. Only 14 peso and the  2 hour boat ride down the canon was only 190 peso. So i wouldnt bother booking a tour uts easy enough to do on your own and cheaper

393283878.name: Good trip destination
393283878.author: a TripAdvisor user
393283878.reviewBody: Best place to catch the canyon tour. Nice and safe town, small enough to see in an afternoon, with easy Combis from tuxtla

393053897.name: Very pretty town
393053897.author: a TripAdvisor user
393053897.reviewBody: Chiapa de Corzo is beautiful. Lots of great shopping. It is hot here compared to San Cristobal de las Casas. The square is so unique. Lots to see and do right around the square.

387068224.name: Traditional beautiful little town very close to Tuxtla on the way to San Cristobal.
387068224.author: a TripAdvisor user
387068224.reviewBody: If you want to walk safe & see different attractions this is the place to visit. They know how to handle tourism without sacrificing their authenticity. You can catch a bus from Tuxtla to this town or to drive there is good space for parking. What I like the most about Chiapa is that you get a longer trip in the Grijalba river to see the Canion of the Sumidero from the River, which is really awesome mainly in rain season, of course when is not raining you don\u00b4t get to see all the fautains falling from the Canion, but you get to see the birds, & the green area. The fauna is marvelous so it is the major highlight. There are good restaurants, great artesanias shops & snacks, ice cream from the region. It is worth just walking in their colonial streets it is really beautiful. Also to me going to Chapa to take the boats is safer that looking for the other options in Tuxtla where you\u00b4d need a taxi to take you or a graet sense of direction.

383630833.name: Historic rest stop on route through Chiapas
383630833.author: a TripAdvisor user
383630833.reviewBody: We stopped here on our way to San Cristobal and Palenque.  Small town, walkable, people very friendly.   Could see everything in a afternoon.

378593731.name: Very nice town
378593731.author: a TripAdvisor user
378593731.reviewBody: Very classical town, full of crafts, enjoyable. Bring sunscreen, a hat and plenty of water. Heat and humidity are severe!

373586831.name: A quaint old city
373586831.author: a TripAdvisor user
373586831.reviewBody: This quaint and beautiful old city is very near Tuxtla and Canon del Sumidero, actually overlooking the canyon.  The pictured main square is absolutely beautiful and meticulously designed.  The people are friendly and there\'s plenty of shopping and food choices for that part of your trip; you won\'t want to leave.

367651151.name: Interesting bit of history
367651151.author: a TripAdvisor user
367651151.reviewBody: This town has an interesting archaeological history and its main feature is the central plaza. This plaza has a number of important features. The largest and best known is the La Pila fountain. This was constructed in 1562 in Moorish style, made of brick in the form of a diamond. Another important feature is the La Pochota kapok tree. According to tradition, the Spanish town was founded around this tree. The last feature is a clock tower which was constructed in the 1950s. The town\u2019s main structures are centred on this plaza, including the municipal palace.  Around the plaza are many shops and stalls.  It is a very pretty town on the way to San Cristobal from Tuxtia and a starting point for the Sumidero Canyon boats.

360388406.name: The entrance to Canyon Del Sumidero .
360388406.author: a TripAdvisor user
360388406.reviewBody: This nice little town is half way between San Cristobal de las Casas and Tuxtla Gutiererrez . The entrance to the Canyon Del Sumidero is two blocks west of the main plaza . We had a excellent fish dinner by the river . Then I sat and relaxed while my wife shopped .

359405167.name: Pretty nice small town
359405167.author: a TripAdvisor user
359405167.reviewBody: This small town is 30 minutes from Tuxtla Gutierrez by taxi, the cost by taxi is $150 mexican pesos. In this place you can find a lot of crafts and souvenirs, mexican restaurantes and the boat station for visit the Sumidero Canyon. Is a really nice place with many things to do, in the night you can listen live music in the downtown and you can eat many desserts.

357966767.name: Make sure to check out the Parachicos headdress
357966767.author: a TripAdvisor user
357966767.reviewBody:
I believe Chiapa de Corzo is one of the only places you can find such a headdress.  If you are a collector of masks and such, might be worthwhile to check it out.
Town square is beautiful (although in the midst of some renovations).
If you are driving to Chiapa de Corzo don't be too surprised to find a nice chap who covers your windshield with cardboard to block the sun (for a small tip of course).
Make sure to try the $35 peso hamburger across from the Mercado.  (A word of advice:  the hamburger patty is extremely thin [and I mean, thin] so you might want to order a double patty).  Don't miss the boat tour of the Sumidero Canyon

349406669.name: very interesting place with many atrations
349406669.author: a TripAdvisor user
349406669.reviewBody: you can visit the main plaza, and enjoy very good food in the arrounds , and aslo from there is very close the harbor to vist el ca\u00f1on  del sumidero

339774069.name: Visit Chiapa de Corzo in order to board the boats that travel through the Sumidero Canyon
339774069.author: a TripAdvisor user
339774069.reviewBody: Intersting town with a park with a nice fountain, but its most important attraction is the wharf where you board the boats that take you through the Sumidero Canyon.  You cannot leave the area without visiting the canyon.

336963517.name: magical
336963517.author: a TripAdvisor user
336963517.reviewBody: This is one of the mexican places where magic lives and you will enjoy along with other natural marvels like Ca\u00f1\u00f3n del Sumidero.

333933613.name: It\'s OK if you are around
333933613.author: a TripAdvisor user
333933613.reviewBody: Not much to see here, but after going on the boat ride through the Sumidero Canyon, this little town is only a few minutes away, and spending an hour or so to visit it is okay. In the middle of the downtown square plaza there is a beautiful kiosk-like building resembling a crown or a little moorish fort. This building is portrayed in the seal of the state of Chiapas as a symbol of the power of the Spanish settlers. Around it, a number of buildings with arches and corridors to walk, with many stores, restaurants and bars. Next there is a large church or monastery, -we couldn\'t tell since it was closed-, that looks nice from the distance but needs a little bit of maintenance. Several street vendors offering beautiful (and ugly) regional clothing, some with excellent prices, at least compared to other more famous cities in Chiapas.

329352185.name: Not much to do
329352185.author: a TripAdvisor user
329352185.reviewBody: We stopped here as part of a tour to the Ca\u00f1\u00f3n de Sumidero. It was so hot, nothing really to see or do in the time we had. We walked down to the market but it was a pretty small and uninspiring market. There were lots of people selling dulces tipicos but it felt like a waste.

296595574.name: a disappointment
296595574.author: a TripAdvisor user
296595574.reviewBody: Do not come during important holidays, as the place gets completely overcrowded. The line to the canyon raft is endless. It was such a disappointing moment to travel across the globe and the see a chaotic, disorganized cue for the canyon rafting and where no employees know what\'s going on, how long will it take to get a ticket, nada. A disaster. Most of the tickets are booked through travel agencies ahead of time and an individual random visitor has no chance, but you are welcome to stand in line for several hours....

292459022.name: Cute Pueblo magico
292459022.author: a TripAdvisor user
292459022.reviewBody: A nice town for a wander, if you are staying in Tuxtla the colectivos cost 13 peso from Ave. 2a Sur in between Calles 5a and 6a. We spent an hour or two looking around the plaza, there are heaps of stalls and shops selling clothing, bags, jewellery, food, ice creams etc so a good place if you are after a souvenir. The church is quite big and you can pay 10 peso to climb the bell tower. This gets you a great view of the town, mountains and a little of the river. I\'d join the town visit with a boat trip up to see the canyon as this departs from the town as well. Unfortunately when we went it was mid afternoon and they had no more tickets for the boats so we will have to return another day.

285868165.name: Bit of a let down
285868165.author: a TripAdvisor user
285868165.reviewBody: Not much to see or do here. Church, plaza and big tree. Very nice locals. Trip advisor reviewers are posting pics of Canon de Sumidero...this is NOT the canyon. Reviews should be about Chiapa de Corzo...church, plaza and tree. That\'s really about it. I did have some good coconut ice cream for about 25 pesos.

265480076.name: Awesome Town
265480076.author: a TripAdvisor user
265480076.reviewBody: Highly Recommend, a town so pintrest and friendly. Nice accessories & souvenirs to buy. Good Deals and fun surroundings to visit. The "Kiosko" beautiful Brick structure, to admire!

261535680.name: The Gateway to the Sumidero Canyon
261535680.author: a TripAdvisor user
261535680.reviewBody: Chiapa de Corzo offers little to traveller in Chiapas other than an entry point to the spectacular Sumidero Canyon. Chiapa de Corso offers poor hotels and restaurants, but is necessary to visitors to the canyon. So be clear about what you expect. This is NOT the Sumidero Canyo.

255500564.name: What a wonderful boat ride.
255500564.author: a TripAdvisor user
255500564.reviewBody: This was a great gorge boat ride. We saw monkeys, lots of birds and crocodiles but the main thing was the views of the spectacular views in the gorge. Not as good as the 3 gorges dam area in China but very close. it is a must see and do thing when in Mexico

254863581.name: HAve a nice trip by boat
254863581.author: a TripAdvisor user
254863581.reviewBody: This is a nice one afternoon trip from Tuxtla Gutierrez. Chiapa de Corzo is a cosy town that have lots of little restaurants and small shops. It is possible to take a boat ride for about 200 pesos (2015) in a group and you will most probably see a crocodile too.

253612334.name: quaint town, classic Cathedral next to an amazing Canyon
253612334.author: a TripAdvisor user
253612334.reviewBody: The town itself is small. with winding cobblestone streets, restaurants. gift shops and a huge brick structure that is an effigy to the queen of spains crown, i believe, the main reason folks go here is to  head down the river to book a boat ride through the sumidero canyon,  there is restaurants on the riverfront which seem alot busier than the ones by the town square, there are two boat companies that seem to work together, we arrived at 10 am and were heading back by 3 to San Christobal, you can take a cab to the coopertivo bus stop which runs trips all day long back to San Christobal de las Casas or Tuxtla, I consider the local bus lines safe and affordable!

247083024.name: Small dandy town
247083024.author: a TripAdvisor user
247083024.reviewBody: It\'s a nice stop after the sumidero canyon!! But not worth the whole afternoon... You can find good food in the restaurants around the plaza and there are many options for vegetarians

245726103.name: Fun outing
245726103.author: a TripAdvisor user
245726103.reviewBody: Fun place to walk around. Very picturesque. The main attraction is the replica in the square of queen Isabel\'s of Spain crown made out of bricks which when visited was getting a face lift it crown lift. The moment you park children run up to you to sell you anything. The church was very nice. On the way to the church there was a group of four women embroidering a bridal veil. There are many shoppes around the square to walk around and look. On the corner of the square there is a very good place to buy amber. It has different pieces than what you find put with the street peddlers   At the opposite end you will find a michoacana paleta Popsicle whee they have good frozen Popsicles.

245390929.name: Worthwile for a day visit!
245390929.author: a TripAdvisor user
245390929.reviewBody:
I stayed a few days in Tuxtla and visited Chiapa de Corzo and the Canon for one day. 

The speedboat drive in the Canon as well as Chiapa de Corzo were worthwile a visit. I even saw a crocodile in the canon. 

Chiapa de Corzo is a historic village with old builidngs. Definitely, a must when you are around there.

244778484.name: only fountain
244778484.author: a TripAdvisor user
244778484.reviewBody: its a small little village we passed to go to san christobal. the only thing worth seeing here is a mujedar style fountain in the town square. little shops ring the square but they are quite expensive for such a tiny place. clean though.

243241550.name: Small And Quiet
243241550.author: a TripAdvisor user
243241550.reviewBody: This is a very nice little village to visit to experience Mexico.  We took a shuttle from the cruise ship dock for $20 and spent a few hours there.  The nicest thing was not having the locals come up and beg.  The main plaza is a great place to see everything.

241854079.name: unless you look for an embarcadero, skip
241854079.author: a TripAdvisor user
241854079.reviewBody: just another village, nothing special to waste your time, unless you need a less expensive hotel or comedor, we entered looking for the embarcadero to the canyon, and we made a mistake.

238475741.name: Sleepy little town
238475741.author: a TripAdvisor user
238475741.reviewBody:
This little town was our first stop in our journey, the fountain is an icon to admire and take lots of pictures of, also the centennial ceiba tree which has stood there since before the mexican revolution... 
It's very relaxing to walk along "los arcos" (covered archways stretching all around the main plaza) with its many souvenir shops and mexican candy stores, very typical of the Chiapas culture.

Don't miss the Cañon del Sumidero boat ride that starts there and the Mirador del Campanario. This second one almost nobody knows about, because it's not advertised, so only a few people actually go, it's the bell tower of the main church (can't miss it on your way to the embarcadero) go in and move towards the big main altar, on your left there is a very little stone entrance and a person sitting behind an unassuming desk, pay your $10 pesos per person fee and climb!!

After you catch your breath, the view will take it back from you!! (the only thing not allowed there is to ring the bells which are huge) feel free to roam around.

One last thing, on the back side of the church there's a whole block of food street vendors, their specialty is "hamburgers and hot dogs", not at all what we are used to, these are the biggest burgers you have seen with all the toppings you can imagine! Only $35 pesos!! We ate the regular and it was delicious! DID NOT get sick at all and even came back later for seconds...

235651055.name: Nice but nothing extraordinary
235651055.author: a TripAdvisor user
235651055.reviewBody: The village is nice but nothing special. You feel that people are used to tourists because of the boat tours to the canon. It is good to pass through and maybe drink a coffee, but that is it.

235417951.name: Canyon Sumidero
235417951.author: a TripAdvisor user
235417951.reviewBody: The view is nice buy do not go if it is raining or looks likes its gonna rain as they promise to have  a tarp above the boat to protect you from the rain but they DON T.It gets really cold and windy and wet.ALSO YOU NEED TO BE 14 PEOPLE ON THE BOAT FOR IT TO COST YOU 200.PESOS.Bring toilet paper as the bathrooms dont offer any.There is a restautant where you can have a bite.

231870409.name: Pueblo magico
231870409.author: a TripAdvisor user
231870409.reviewBody: Like many, I came here to visit the canyon, but thanks to the people at Moon Guide, whose map of TG contained more errors than accuracies (Yes, I did get a full refund), by the time I found the true bus stop and got to C de C, it was too late to go up the canyon. But all was not lost as it was utterly charming, with a pretty central plaza, a tranquil air, a really unusual fountain, and pleasant shopping. Highly recommended as a respite from Tuxtla. There are also some interesting ruins here but the Moon guidebook failed to mention this. Needless to say, I no longer buy Moon guidebooks. Have seen similar comments on other TA posts.

207940953.name: Chiapa de Corzo ~ Sumidero Landing
207940953.author: a TripAdvisor user
207940953.reviewBody: This is an interesting Magic Town near Tuxtla Gutierrez. It\'s where you take boats into the damn area of Sumidero. The cliffs are dramatic and well worth the boat ride. \nThe town was being remodeled while we visited, but the locals told us it would be ready by end of summer. \nThere are some excellent restaurants and lots of shops. Well worth a visit.

203324559.name: Wonderful place to know the culture
203324559.author: a TripAdvisor user
203324559.reviewBody: We didn\'t know much about the area. Discovered that approximately 90% of the people hardly understood or spoke Spanish.

195307385.name: Ride the Boats, Town is Average
195307385.author: a TripAdvisor user
195307385.reviewBody: The boat ride in Sumidero Canyon was fantastic.  I would highly recommend the trip to everyone.  The town of Chiapa de Corzo is clean, they sell a few crafts, but it\'s an average town.

193790486.name: if you don\u00b4t have enough time you can miss it
193790486.author: a TripAdvisor user
193790486.reviewBody: it is a very little place whith a monument in the middle of town that is the only thing that it is worthy to visit, so if you don\u00b4t have enough time, you can miss the place and you will not regret it

190971058.name: Don\'t Plan on Spending Much Time Here
190971058.author: a TripAdvisor user
190971058.reviewBody: You go through this town when you go to the Canyon del Sumidero. There is not much to do or see. Park here, head to the canyon and then head on to eat somewhere else.

189423356.name: Great place to see
189423356.author: a TripAdvisor user
189423356.reviewBody: A multitude of vendors , amusement for little children, \nLots of food vendors, had great tamales.\nCamion ride to it and back to city is easy to find

188859986.name: Quaint little town
188859986.author: a TripAdvisor user
188859986.reviewBody: Little town with the only attraction being the fountain. Worth stopping on the way from Tuxtla to San Cristobal. Nothing that special.

188824902.name: charming town
188824902.author: a TripAdvisor user
188824902.reviewBody: The town itself is charming.  The square and church are worth a visit.  This is where you catch the boats to tour sumadero canyon.

182890642.name: Nice but not spectacular
182890642.author: a TripAdvisor user
182890642.reviewBody: This small village was part of our tour to the Sumidero canyon. It was ok to walk around for an hour but not that fascinating. There are some souvenir shops, a market with local food and a cute little church where you can climb up the bell tower for 10 pesos and have a really nice view. It\'s nice enough to look at if you are in the area anyway but not worth a trip by itself.

181070343.name: Chiapa de Corzo, such a nice place
181070343.author: a TripAdvisor user
181070343.reviewBody: I have been In Chiapa de Corzo several times. This is a small old town. You can take a boat here and explore Sumidero Canyon along the river where you will see espectacular landscapes. \nIn Chiapa de Corzo you also will be able to explore all kinds of handcrafts and delicious traditional food from the region.

180598408.name: Local lifestyle, food, customs, art!
180598408.author: a TripAdvisor user
180598408.reviewBody: It is a rather small town where very old taste still persists. Ladies selling artesanal candies and food (all natural and great tasting by the way), folklore, art, lots of details to see. Be patient and look all around you, you will get to see very nice people willing to do anything to please you, so heart warming, and charming at the same time! Open your mind, and you will see lots of beautiful local customs!

174818031.name: Lovely entryway for the Ca\u00f1on del Sumidero
174818031.author: a TripAdvisor user
174818031.reviewBody: Very good prices for boat trips, great folk-art. Great food. Could use to be a little be cleaner, but aside from that, had a great time.

160631755.name: great day out
160631755.author: a TripAdvisor user
160631755.reviewBody: Boat ride through the Sumidero Canyon was excellent with crocodiles, monkeys and awesome birdlife inside the 1km high canyon walls.

670744794.name: A fun stop
670744794.author: a TripAdvisor user
670744794.reviewBody: We sort of stumbled into this place, and figured why not check it out.  Inside there is everything you\'d even want to know about the instrument, and some of the accomplished players of it.  There is a section showing how they are constructed, and a studio where some friendly musicians play for you and even give you a quick lesson.  Fun time well spent.

626220650.name: Local museum
626220650.author: a TripAdvisor user
626220650.reviewBody: Next to the square with the same name. Is a really small local museum but very interesting. \n\nWe also saw some teachers playing the marimba and it was pretty nice!

554006122.name: Charming local museum
554006122.author: a TripAdvisor user
554006122.reviewBody: This museum is free by entrance and you can spend anything between 10 minutes to an hour there. Its interesting to see the evolution of the marimba, though it might lack some information and the photos of the local musicians. A free marimba session is offered at the end of your visit.

391734610.name: Small but interesting
391734610.author: a TripAdvisor user
391734610.reviewBody: This very small museum is dedicated to the history and music of the marimba. They have a wonderful historical collection of marimbas from the earliest, rustic instruments to the most modern, intricately designed marimbas. The museum also showcases the history of marimba musicians through a series of photographs. One of the curators gave us a guided tour and was very knowledgeable about the topic. They have a studio there and on-site teachers who provide marimba lessons. They gave us a demonstration and we bought a few CDs. Definitely worth the time.

386532416.name: Heartwarming, delightful concert and lots of learning!
386532416.author: a TripAdvisor user
386532416.reviewBody: We did find the concert on the loud side, but not as bad as another reviewer had indicated.  It was one of the most fun events we did on our whole trip, singing along and sharing old traditional Mexican and international songs.  Everybody smiling and singing, even my monolingual English-speaking husband, as some songs were known in English as well.  We gained a tremendous respect for the intricacy of the marimba, and the talent of the players who could hold two sticks in each hand and play four notes simultaneously.   Wide range of marimbas on display; photo displays taught us a lot about a few outstandingly famous marimba players.

356207576.name: A taste of Chiapas
356207576.author: a TripAdvisor user
356207576.reviewBody: My boyfriend\'s family just happened to know the owners of this place, so we traveled here to learn the history of this instrument as well as discover the process of how it is created. It\'s a great way to learn about Chiapas and its people.

353875982.name: Free and delightful
353875982.author: a TripAdvisor user
353875982.reviewBody: An interesting history of marimba with many different models of instruments,and they played live music for us!

267641123.name: Private show
267641123.author: a TripAdvisor user
267641123.reviewBody: The band gave us a private concert and let us step behind the marimba to try our skills!\nThe museum itself if quite small but if you love music, you will appreciate how complex playing this instrument actually is!

245971722.name: good enough, with some serious dangers
245971722.author: a TripAdvisor user
245971722.reviewBody: This is a very informative and very affordable museum which is certainly worth visiting. However, you will be offered a free (tips only) marimba concert in one of the museum smaller rooms. This  event will most probably be the loudest musical event of your entire life. Your ear drums might be permanently damaged. Beware! - I am sure that the three performers are half-deaf and are unaware of what they damage they are causing.

626220870.name: A must in Tuxtla
626220870.author: a TripAdvisor user
626220870.reviewBody: Next to the zocalo square. \n\nVery big and pretty to see. Isa must in the citty and open in the morning.

618330553.name: Interesting
618330553.author: a TripAdvisor user
618330553.reviewBody: This is probably the only funny Cathedral I\'ve ever seen. When the [tinny] bells ring out the hour, strange, amateurish-looking figured come out of the tower and March around. It\'s well worth a trip just to see it.

597055322.name: Like St. Marks in Venice but with a Mexican flavor
597055322.author: a TripAdvisor user
597055322.reviewBody: We attended the 12 noon Mass here. It was beautiful. The bells sound just like the ones in Venice and at each hour you can see one of the 12 apostles pass by the clock, just like they do in the Prague, Czech Republic. The cathedral is Iit up at night and there is also a mosaic of the apostle Mark made by an Italian artist to the left of the facade.

569465221.name: Diferent
569465221.author: a TripAdvisor user
569465221.reviewBody: The church es in this state Are very colourful diferen compared to others that i seen in many states of mexico

568179495.name: Good starting point to explore town centre
568179495.author: a TripAdvisor user
568179495.reviewBody: The Catedral de San Marcos has a nice Glockenspiel at every full hour, but it is especiall good for start exploring the towen centre. It is just a 15 minutes walk from Parque de la Marimba, and to the south is a the lively market and shopping area.

252663576.name: Gives you a nice overview of artisan goods. Staff is very unhelpful. The quality of goods is mediocre.
252663576.author: a TripAdvisor user
252663576.reviewBody: Crafts are mediocre especially after visiting San Cristobal and the markets in villages in the Highlands. A good spot to pick up a last minute gift at a better price than the airport.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Personas Ilustres de la Revolucion Mexicana #885 Centro

251657584.name: It\'s all relative
251657584.author: a TripAdvisor user
251657584.reviewBody: This museum is pretty much what one would expect to find in a provincial state capitol. Signs all in Spanish, nice but not impressive archeological finds, a decent history section. It was deserted when I was there.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Personas Ilustres de la Revolucion Mexicana #885 Centro

645047817.name: *UN BUEN MOMENTO PARA REFLEXIONAR*
645047817.author: a TripAdvisor user
645047817.reviewBody: Al estar casi a un extremo de una obra que el ser humano realiz\u00f3, sin duda una gran obra que se une con la grandeza de la naturaleza, teniendo as\u00ed un gran momento de imaginaci\u00f3n, calma y serenidad, de sentir como puede el hombre convivir con la naturaleza sin que tenga que destruirla, es agradable ver la extensi\u00f3n del mismo puente chiapas el cual atraviesa un majestuoso r\u00edo, se alcanza ver grandes. Monta\u00f1as que se fusionan u na con otra y sirven de marco para admirar lo grande que es ella y lo peque\u00f1o que podemos ser, se puede disfrutar de alg\u00fan platillo en las diversas palapas que se encuentran en una de su cabeceras, y poder tomar un gran respiro con la familia y admirar las aves, peces y otros seres que por unos instantes se logran ver, sin duda un bonito lugar para relajarse y disfrutar de un platillo t\u00edpico como son mariscos entre otros con el saz\u00f3n de la gente de la localidad. Un lugar que da gusto regresar.

address.streetAddress: Autopista Tuxtla Gutierrez Las Choapas km 140

626602748.name: es una parada obligada
626602748.author: a TripAdvisor user
626602748.reviewBody: cuando vienes por carretera hacia Tuxtla desde M\u00e9xico es una parada obligada ,para ver la presa , hay restaurantes que ofrecen pescado fresco muy sabroso y queso de la region

address.streetAddress: Autopista Tuxtla Gutierrez Las Choapas km 140

616913833.name: Magnificas vistas
616913833.author: a TripAdvisor user
616913833.reviewBody: Ademas de las magnificas vistas que encontraras aqu\u00ed, encontraras una gran cantidad de lugares r\u00fasticos para comer, cada uno tiene un due\u00f1o diferente y hay varias alternativas de pescados, carnes, y por supuesto los frijoles refritos son sensacionales.

address.streetAddress: Autopista Tuxtla Gutierrez Las Choapas km 140

590361437.name: La Mano del Hombre, ante la gran Naturaleza.
590361437.author: a TripAdvisor user
590361437.reviewBody: Definitivamente un lugar casi \u00fanico, donde se nota que tan grande es la naturaleza y peque\u00f1o el hombre, un lugar que se puede admirar desde extremo a extremo pero no parar en medio del mismo, una obra que definitivamente ayud\u00f3 al enlace del centro del pa\u00eds con el Pac\u00edfico pr\u00e1cticamente, del extremo con rumbo a tuxtla Gutierrez est\u00e1n varios comedores que apesar de estar sencillos, se saborean deliciosos platillos que quiz\u00e1s no con una excelente presentaci\u00f3n, si con buen sabor y fresco y preparados casi enfrente del comensal, un lugar para visitar un fin de semana e. Pareja o con la familia. Saludos. DIVERTTI.

address.streetAddress: Autopista Tuxtla Gutierrez Las Choapas km 140

626221329.name: Nice place to walk and relax
626221329.author: a TripAdvisor user
626221329.reviewBody: A little bit far from Zocalo square. Is a very wide and clean space. You can see the city from here. A must in Tuxtla.

673805061.name: museo vivo!
673805061.author: a TripAdvisor user
673805061.reviewBody: es la clase de museo que tiene diversas actividades todo el tiempo, la construcci\u00f3n es tal vez la mejor joya arquitectonica de la ciudad, cuenta con cafeteria para hacer un alto y disfrutar de los jardines que no son muy extensos pero si muy cuidados, casi una visita obligada y en familia.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

653578267.name: Evaluaci\u00f3n
653578267.author: a TripAdvisor user
653578267.reviewBody: El museo de la ciudad est\u00e1 en un hermoso edificio de 1942 y est\u00e1 dedicado al origen desarrollo e historia de la ciudad, asimismo a sus costumbres y tradiciones. Lamentablemente no lo pudimos visitar porque el \u00faltimo temblor del 2017 lo afecto. Las autoridades no muestran un inter\u00e9s por recuperar lo valioso que es su historia, a pesar de que hay una fundaci\u00f3n la cual no es apoyada.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

597930172.name: No olvidar el pasado
597930172.author: a TripAdvisor user
597930172.reviewBody: Este museo rememora \u00e9pocas de gloria pasadas de Tuxtla Guti\u00e9rrez, cuando la modernidad no se habr\u00eda paso a\u00fan, y tambi\u00e9n sus constantes cambios.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

526406260.name: Genera comunidad
526406260.author: a TripAdvisor user
526406260.reviewBody: El museo hace una gran labor de documentar la cambiante identidad de Tuxtla. \n\nTambi\u00e9n es un espacio que genera comunidad con sus diferentes actividades.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

474694709.name: Visita local
474694709.author: a TripAdvisor user
474694709.reviewBody: Visitar el museo de Tuxtla es regresar en el tiempo y visualizar como eran las cosas 50 a\u00f1os atr\u00e1s.\nLo recomiendo a todo publico, ver un poco de historia nunca esta de mas.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

474649409.name: Una recomendaci\u00f3n para el museo.
474649409.author: a TripAdvisor user
474649409.reviewBody: La recomendaci\u00f3n es que deber\u00eda ser un espacio donde se sintetizara todo lo relacionado a la cultura Chiapaneca y no solo eso, dar tips tur\u00edsticos de los lugares atractivos que tiene el estado.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

467709863.name: Simplemente fant\u00e1stico!!
467709863.author: a TripAdvisor user
467709863.reviewBody: Hace unas semanas acud\u00ed con un grupo de alumnos a tomar una sesi\u00f3n con el historiador del lugar, realmente fue una experiencia incre\u00edble, despu\u00e9s de la remodelaci\u00f3n el lugar qued\u00f3 incre\u00edble, la informaci\u00f3n que recibimos fue excepcional sobre todo por la ambientaci\u00f3n y la m\u00fasica de jazz fue lo que le di\u00f3 el toque final a la velada, simplemente me encant\u00f3! Motiva a seguir llevando a nuevas generaciones de estudiantes a conocer sobre su cuidad. Un enorme aplauso para todos los que trabajan en este maravilloso lugar :)

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

455747290.name: una clara muestra del orgullo Tuxtleco.
455747290.author: a TripAdvisor user
455747290.reviewBody: Est\u00e1 montado sobre un bell\u00edsimo edificio colonial reci\u00e9n remozado, con luces dirigidas que de noche lo hacen a\u00fan m\u00e1s bello que de d\u00eda, a dos cuadras de la Plaza Central de Gobierno y de la Catedral, un museo bien puesto, moderno, minimalista, con buen gusto, fresa, quiz\u00e1s con un contenido escaso pero lo que hay es bueno y bonito, en este museo pude sentir el orgullo de ser Tuxtleco, el orgullo de ser indio Zoque (etnia de la zona) eso, indudablemente me encant\u00f3. No tiene costo y est\u00e1 abierto desde las 9 am y hasta muy noche, dentro hay una cafeter\u00eda muy frecuentada por gente joven y una tienda de artesan\u00edas con piezas finas aunque no baratas, algunas cosas si. Su patio es bonito, jard\u00ednada y con un m\u00e1stil Coronado con un \u00e1ngel en posici\u00f3n de Victoria.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

451328716.name: Casi vac\u00edo
451328716.author: a TripAdvisor user
451328716.reviewBody: Luego de hacer el ingreso le preguntamos a la persona que atend\u00eda qu\u00e9 exposiciones hab\u00eda y nos dijo que estaba casi vac\u00eda, y que solamente pod\u00edamos visitar la sala de lectura, la tienda, el caf\u00e9, o una muestra de los zoques (era una habitaci\u00f3n peque\u00f1a con fotos y tres objetos).\nDeber\u00eda estar por fuera de las gu\u00edas tur\u00edsticas.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

446922992.name: Para concocer un poco de historia
446922992.author: a TripAdvisor user
446922992.reviewBody: Es un Museo peque\u00f1o, con un poco de historia de la regi\u00f3n. En un edificio colonial bonito. Si te quedas sin opciones, \u00e9sta es buena para estar un rato. Nada espectacular.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

429320668.name: Excelentes eventos
429320668.author: a TripAdvisor user
429320668.reviewBody: Un buen lugar para disfrutar de un caf\u00e9 y los eventos culturales de la ciudad. fotograf\u00eda, pintura, poes\u00eda, todo en un solo lugar. adem\u00e1s de artesan\u00edas chiapanecas.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

420993001.name: Recorrido por el pasado de ciudad ce los conejos.
420993001.author: a TripAdvisor user
420993001.reviewBody: en un edifico remodelado que en anta\u00f1o, cobijo a la presidencia municiapal de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gitierrez, sus pasillos y habitaciones amplias, que nos dejan ver, ropa, utensilios , objetos y muebles, de la epoca, de las familias de abolengo de la capital, asi como de sus hombres ilustres. jardines y un momento de relax e historia.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

412975280.name: Buena opci\u00f3n para descubrir
412975280.author: a TripAdvisor user
412975280.reviewBody: Un lugar con mucha informaci\u00f3n acerca de la regi\u00f3n desde los tiempos prehisp\u00e1nicos y de la colonia, un ambiente agradable y tranquilo y con muchas cosas que ver, suele encontrarse con pocos visitantes, sin embargo, es un lugar muy bien cuidado y amplio, los domingos las entradas son gratis y se encuentra cerca de otras \u00e1reas para visitar como el jard\u00edn bot\u00e1nico, el teatro de la ciudad y el museo de paleontolog\u00eda.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

397099012.name: Sincretismo entre modernidad e historia
397099012.author: a TripAdvisor user
397099012.reviewBody: Para comenzar el edificio en donde se aloja el museo, es un elegante y bellisimo prototipo de los edificios (palacetes) del siglo XIX - el director del museo por el hecho de ser tan joven, tiene ideas modernas y funcionales por lo que le dan al museo un cierto ambiente de refugio ante el t\u00f3rrido calor de la capital Tuxtleca. en cuanto a su contenido hist\u00f3rico - esta lleno de ejemplos de como era la vida en los siglos pasados en las haciendas cafetaleras y en las ciudades importantes de Chiapas

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

381273988.name: oscio
381273988.author: a TripAdvisor user
381273988.reviewBody: muy buen lugar para concer la historia de la ciudad cabe mencionar que es de los ultimos edificios que existen de la antigua tuxtla aunque acaba de ser remodelado conserva su estetica original. Hay que seguir preservando estos lugares que la historia de la ciudad y su identidad zoque no se pierda.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

370236137.name: Incre\u00edble lugar!!!
370236137.author: a TripAdvisor user
370236137.reviewBody: Una visita obligada para quienes visitan Chiapas y Tuxtla Guti\u00e9rrez. Un gran ejemplo de la solidaridad y cooperaci\u00f3n entre sociedad civil y autoridades.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

369855102.name: \u00a1Hoy se reinaugura!
369855102.author: a TripAdvisor user
369855102.reviewBody: Lugar para conocer el inicio de la ciudad, su historia, tradiciones y leyendas; se puede tomar un exquisito caf\u00e9 en el patio.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

358312009.name: Un recorrido muy corto
358312009.author: a TripAdvisor user
358312009.reviewBody: El edificio que alberga el museo de la ciudad es de una arquitectura muy bonita, existe una sala que explica desde la fundaci\u00f3n de la ciudad hasta el cambio urbano que ha sufrido, suele tener un espacio para exposiciones temporales. La administraci\u00f3n siempre le agrada tener eventos, por ejemplo conciertos filarm\u00f3nicos y tardes de cine.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

356200885.name: Recien remodelado
356200885.author: a TripAdvisor user
356200885.reviewBody: Reciende remodelado, de los \u00faltimos edificios de la ciudad que muetran la arquitectura de su \u00e9poca.\nUna cafeter\u00eda autosustentable administrada por emprendedores jovenes entusiastas.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

332166836.name: lo estan remodelando
332166836.author: a TripAdvisor user
332166836.reviewBody: preciozo vale la  visitarlo para conocer de nuestras culturas y tadiciones cuando terminen de remodelarlo? visitenlo

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutierrez

251658359.name: Lush oasis
251658359.author: a TripAdvisor user
251658359.reviewBody: This is a lush oasis of tranquility and greenery in a hot and dusty yet humid (an odd combo) city. I\'ve no particular interest in plants, but found this a wonderful place to relax.

526423935.name: Buena ubicaci\u00f3n.
526423935.author: a TripAdvisor user
526423935.reviewBody: Para ir a pasar un buen rato con familia o amigos .cuando hay partidos de f\u00fatbol llegan personas a vender souvenirs de tus equipos favoritos..se vive buen ambiente..

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

479596014.name: Estadio con mal panorama para ver el futbol
479596014.author: a TripAdvisor user
479596014.reviewBody: Es un estadio viejo, solo arreglado por fuera, pero por dentro esta deteriorado, y la pista hace que la vista del juego sea bastante lejano

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

477711481.name: Buena opci\u00f3n para los amantes del futbol.
477711481.author: a TripAdvisor user
477711481.reviewBody: Es un estadio de tama\u00f1o regular con muy buena ubicaci\u00f3n, del Hotel Marriot al estadio un taxi cobra 80 pesos. Los boletos no es f\u00e1cil conseguirlos por internet con anticipaci\u00f3n, y generalmente se consiguen boletos en la zona preferente (sol general) sin lugares numerados. Suficiente seguridad y buen ambiente.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

474661974.name: Partido de futbol
474661974.author: a TripAdvisor user
474661974.reviewBody: Es un estadio de gama baja por as\u00ed decirlo, le falta un poco de organizaci\u00f3n y la seguridad deja mucho que desear.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

465564407.name: Oportunidad para ver a las CHIVAS
465564407.author: a TripAdvisor user
465564407.reviewBody: Aprovechando nuestra estancia en Tuxtla Gutierrez y coincidiendo con la visita de las CHIVAS en su juego contra los JAGUARES pues acudimos al estadio y no perder la oportunidad de ver el juego.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

445335400.name: casa del jaguar
445335400.author: a TripAdvisor user
445335400.reviewBody: Lo que uno busca al entrar a un estadio de fut bol independientemente de divertirse con un buen juego, es la seguridad con los ni\u00f1os, y al menos aqui puede uno hacerlo sin problemas, la gente respeta....

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

438881989.name: Un ambiente incre\u00edble
438881989.author: a TripAdvisor user
438881989.reviewBody: Venir a este estadio a presenciar un juego de futbol de la primera division de M\u00e9xico, es algo especial, un ambiente familiar.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

401746402.author: a TripAdvisor user
401746402.reviewBody: un hotel bueno bonito y barato cerca del estadio es el citty express junior. \nLas cervezas es mejor bajar a comprarlas porq los vendedores siempre las traen calientes. \n

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

398659670.name: Jaguares \ud83d\udc4d\ud83c\udffc
398659670.author: a TripAdvisor user
398659670.reviewBody: El estadio esta bien agradable, su ambiente en los dias de futbol se siente muy  familiar, las\nInstalaciones se encuentran bien, cuenta con una amplia zona de parqueo y esta en un sector de facil acceso.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

370127100.name: Ahora se disfruta mejor!
370127100.author: a TripAdvisor user
370127100.reviewBody: El estadio Jaguar, en donde he tra\u00eddo a parientes y amigos a ver los partidos de su equipo favorito contra los aguerridos locales. Ahora que los juegos son nocturnos, es mucho m\u00e1s agradable la estancia.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

358311199.name: Estadio del Jaguar
358311199.author: a TripAdvisor user
358311199.reviewBody: El cambio de direcci\u00f3n en el equipo les beneficio. El estadio es muy bonito, su exterior tiene un juego de luces muy vistoso, aunque adentro es muy chico pero se ve muy bien las acciones. NO TIENE MARCADOR ELECTR\u00d3NICO, as\u00ed que es muy com\u00fan preguntar el marcador. Les recomiendo visitarlo, es muy tranquilo. Los partidos de copa, suelen ser gratuitos ;)

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

357992847.name: preciozo estadio
357992847.author: a TripAdvisor user
357992847.reviewBody: esta recien inaugurado quedo bonito , solo que los ba\u00f1os les falto mas espacio quedan muy peque\u00f1os ,para tanta gente que llega a los partidos no se dan abasto

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

345056496.name: Estadio viejo
345056496.author: a TripAdvisor user
345056496.reviewBody: Estadio muy viejo, les falta remodelarlo y poner cosas modernas como los estadios de otros estados en Mexico

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

342660958.name: Futbol
342660958.author: a TripAdvisor user
342660958.reviewBody: Buen lugar para ir a ver a tu equipo jugar y mejor verlo ganar, estadio bien ubicado, buen en el tema de seguridad, costos accesibles.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

320795734.name: NO debes ir MEJOR POR tv
320795734.author: a TripAdvisor user
320795734.reviewBody: Ubicaci\u00f3n p\u00e9sima organizaci\u00f3n peor no se dan abasto si llegas con poco tiempo tienes que dejar al auto muy muy lejos el boleto no te sirve de nada los que revisan en la entrada son como judiciales de la \u00e9poca de Echeverr\u00eda la cerveza caliente y escaza la capacidad del estadio muy peque\u00f1a en partidos de equipos grandes ni caben.\nNO VAYAS

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

315923366.name: Aqu\u00ed juega el equipo de futbol de primera divisi\u00f3n de Chiapas.
315923366.author: a TripAdvisor user
315923366.reviewBody: Cuando es temporada de futbol, es bueno ir a disfrutar del equipo local de primera divisi\u00f3n, el estadio se llena cuando el equipo local se enfrenta con equipos de mayor trascendencia futbolistica. Si eres de los que le gusta conocer los estadios de futbol, vale  la pena ir a ver un partido.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de las Etnias S/N Boulevard Fidel Velazquez Col. Infonavit el Grijalva

659644441.name: A big plaza
659644441.author: a TripAdvisor user
659644441.reviewBody: Its a big square on the main street of Tuxtla.  At night is when the Marimbas are playing and you see mostly seniors dancing the night away.  Around the square, there are many coffee shops and restaurants.

652151641.name: Traditions
652151641.author: a TripAdvisor user
652151641.reviewBody:
This little Park is full of traditions.  At night people goes to the park to dance to the sound of live music.  They play the Marimba a tipical instrument of the region, a lot of couples dress up and perfume to go dance and enjoy themselves. Their are few green benches where people sit to see the dancers.  Usualy these people who are seated got there very early to make sure they had a good seat.  

There is usualy family with children walking around and buying treats to eat that are also tipical of the regions like Churros, Elotes, Tamales etc.

Its totaly free to enjoy so why not spend an hour in the evening there to feel that Tuxtla tradition.

626220416.name: Nice park
626220416.author: a TripAdvisor user
626220416.reviewBody:
Next to the museum of marimbas. 

Nice and clean park and you can see locals relaxing. 

Also you can see the tuxtla sign and the little marimba monuments.

605455502.name: Love It! Enjoy Your Evening in Tuxtla!
605455502.author: a TripAdvisor user
605455502.reviewBody: We were staying in Tuxtla Gutierrez beginning of our 2 weeks trip in Chiapas and had to return at the end of the trip. Evening in Parque de la Marimba was so fun to watch the people and listen to the great music of Marimba Orquesta La Reyna Tuxtleca! Friendly local people, good and reasonable food around the Plaza. Free live Marimba music entertainment every evening 6 p.m. to 9 p.m. as some local dancers wear their beautiful traditional attire on the weekends.\nTamales street vendor with table and benches by the Parque  ( I think Mama de Gloria) was so delicious! Must eat CHIPILIN Tamales!

595337469.name: Fun Evening
595337469.author: a TripAdvisor user
595337469.reviewBody: It was something fun to do after dinner. Great place to people watch, listen to marimba music and observe all of the couples dancing. The park was filled with famlies strolling the park.

589281861.name: Are You Kiddding Me>??????
589281861.author: a TripAdvisor user
589281861.reviewBody: This place is absolutely a must!  We loved dancing in the park with locals who were all friendly and kind.  Tons of food options around the park and festival atmosphere.  Easy to get to , however parking is only on public streets, so you might have to walk for a while depending on when you get there.  The music was incredible!  We thoroughly loved our evening at Marimba Park!  Really a cultural gem in Mexico!

572048423.name: Awesome place to immerse in the culture and music
572048423.author: a TripAdvisor user
572048423.reviewBody: We stopped by for an hour or so and the park was packed! Definitely the place to be during the Easter vacation. Plenty of places in the park and across the street for snacks, coffees, and random souvenirs. Great music, friendly people, and some amazing dancers. If you are in the area, I recommend visiting!

569464781.name: If you want to dance?
569464781.author: a TripAdvisor user
569464781.reviewBody: It nice park , where the adulto mayor gors to liasen and in same cases go to dance to old Classic music

569194959.name: Lugar Agradable/Nice Place
569194959.author: a TripAdvisor user
569194959.reviewBody: Lugar agradable para pasar la tarde: m\u00fasica de marimba, gente bailando, vendedores de comida y artesan\u00eda.\nNice place to spend the evening: \u201cmarimba\u201d music, people dancing, snacks and typical crafts.

568179080.name: Nice Stopover
568179080.author: a TripAdvisor user
568179080.reviewBody: Fed up with beautiful colonial towns and wonderfully restored puebla magicas and in need for some \u201ereal\u201c city life? Then Tuxtla Gut\u00ederrez makes a nice stopover for at least a couple of hours, and the Parque de la Marimba is a good place to start strolling (20-25 minutes drive by taxi from the ADO bus station depending on the traffic, you can leave your luggage in storage at the station). The park is most lively in the evening, but it was also pleasant in the afternoon when we were there, and there are plenty of restaurants where you can settle and watch people.

557575491.name: Fun, fun, fun!
557575491.author: a TripAdvisor user
557575491.reviewBody: It\u2019s exactly what you\u2019d expect - marimba orquesta playing, lots of people dancing, even more just listening, tons of food carts around. \nA great way to spend an evening!

549774954.name: The heart of town at night
549774954.author: a TripAdvisor user
549774954.reviewBody: It\u2019s a typical charming  Mexican square from the afternoon onwards. Locals arrive and hang out, chat, flitter among different groups and the sounds of live marimba music playing in the kiosk.

505649449.name: Nice walk
505649449.author: a TripAdvisor user
505649449.reviewBody: If you are staying in Tuxtla upon your arrival...pass by the plaza de la marimba before you take dinner, an option could be pinchanchas, not for the food but for the dances and decorations.

494985220.name: Nice place
494985220.author: a TripAdvisor user
494985220.reviewBody: Nice place to watch people dancing danzones. You can buy refreshments and souvenirs around the plaza.

476524507.name: Traditional Marimba & Dancing Spot
476524507.author: a TripAdvisor user
476524507.reviewBody: My wife and I, love this little park in Tuxtla Gutierrez, since every single day at night (7 to 9 pm) you can enjoy of music played by Marimbas and at the same time dance to the its rhythm. Right after dancing you can have a refreshing local ice cream or fruit beverage.

474811243.name: So relaxing and entertaining
474811243.author: a TripAdvisor user
474811243.reviewBody: Going there at night on the weekends is such a wonderful experience, the music makes you want to join and dance with all the couples who gather here to dance the whole night. Take your time to sit and just enjoy the scenery and the music

460547085.name: Best way to spend an evening in Tuxtla Gutierrez
460547085.author: a TripAdvisor user
460547085.reviewBody: My sister and I recently spent three days in Tuxtla after studying Spanish for two weeks in San Cristobal de las Casas. The first place we visited was marimba park on a Sunday night. We were delighted with the cool breezes blowing through the trees throughout the park, the colorful attire of the people, the range of ages involved and the friendliness of everyone in the park. The music started at a slower pace and then the beat picked up. Lots of people were dancing, others just relax and enjoy beautiful winter evening in the park. This is the best way to keep cool on a warm night in Tuxtla. Different marimba bands play every night of the week. Arrive before 6 o\'clock to get a seat. Plenty of different places to eat or have coffee around the perimeter of the park. Not to be missed! No charge either!

457894588.name: A Very Enjoyable Sunda
457894588.author: a TripAdvisor user
457894588.reviewBody: We ate dinner just across the street and were attracted by the music and festive atmosphere so went to observe. A really nice family event with a huge crowd , all appearing to have a great time. The local music was great but the biggest treat was watching the huge crowd of locals do a line dance to the Spanish version of Achy Breaky Heart.  A really fun local experience. Highly recommended.

456998136.name: Very funny place
456998136.author: a TripAdvisor user
456998136.reviewBody: I want to the parque de la marimba and I have to say the place is so happy when I arrived there I heard the music and I have seen a lot of people there like a huge party with a lot of people getting fun and enjoying the moment with the family and friends. Very recommended!

454738632.name: Beautiful park in the heart of Tuxtla
454738632.author: a TripAdvisor user
454738632.reviewBody:
This is a central meeting place in downtown Tuxtla. Every evening marimbas and live bands play while the public admires and some dance around the park. 

It is a place to meet up, hang out and enjoy life in the best sense during the evening, before or after dinner. There are snack stands, vendors and artists throughout the park.

448759960.name: Amazing place
448759960.author: a TripAdvisor user
448759960.reviewBody: If you want to spend some time listening to some live music it\'s perfect. Also if you just wanna hand around and have something to drink around. It\'s better if you go in the noon when the live music is being play. Great environment.

442750688.name: Very Lively
442750688.author: a TripAdvisor user
442750688.reviewBody: Very likely on a friday evening; lots of people dancing in the square and there are tons of restaurants and fast food places circling the place so you can people watch while you eat.

442544539.name: Fun Fiesta
442544539.author: a TripAdvisor user
442544539.reviewBody: Happened to be in town for the Our Lady of Guadeloupe celebration. The park was packed and the Marimba Band was really playing well.  You can join in the dancing and enjoy the beauty of this little park and the people.

439148125.name: Wonderful place were the Chiapaneca family come out to play
439148125.author: a TripAdvisor user
439148125.reviewBody: This was a wonderful experience. The park gets full of families, from grandparents to little children. A really nice family activity to do and its close to downtown. So you have a couple of nice restaurants within walking distance. Also very safe.

436209894.name: Excellent evening entertainment
436209894.author: a TripAdvisor user
436209894.reviewBody: We were sad that we only had one night in Tuxtla because we wanted to enjoy more of the Marimba music. Get there early, so that you can get a seat. (6:00-9:00pm) every night. A nice couple let us sit on their bench. I got some great pics of people dancing, the balloon man, the clowns and more. It was a lot of fun for all ages.

428866798.name: FUN
428866798.author: a TripAdvisor user
428866798.reviewBody: This park is fun for watching people dancing to life folk marimba (xylophone). You see people of different ages dancing to merengue, samba, etc. The place has a family atmosphere and there are lots of street vendors. Across from the park they sell delicious unusual flavors ice cream.

426237249.name: Marimba
426237249.author: a TripAdvisor user
426237249.reviewBody: Great place to see, dance or listen to traditional Marimba music. The party starts around 6 pm and goes to 10 pm

410284842.name: A PLACE TO RELAX
410284842.author: a TripAdvisor user
410284842.reviewBody: The Park is a safe place to sit down and just relax. In the evenings they have Marimba concerts where locals dance and anyone can join. All for free. A beautiful experience.

400523351.name: Must do when in town
400523351.author: a TripAdvisor user
400523351.reviewBody: This is one of the highly popular parks in town due to the fact that people gather around 6 to hear and dance marimbar. People usually start coming around 4/5pm in order to grab a seat at one of the benches. The music is lively, and the people there are very kind. People seem to come here on a regular basis and greet everyone sitting on the benches (including a tourist like me). It was a pleasant experience.

393282919.name: Good feel for the community
393282919.author: a TripAdvisor user
393282919.reviewBody: Go there for some old time style community dancing and music. Good fun on the Friday night we went, bringing all kinds of locals out to dance to the great Band who were on.

377061436.name: Old-fashioned nightlife in the tropics
377061436.author: a TripAdvisor user
377061436.reviewBody: If you want to see how Tuxtlecos have always had fun, from before the age of nightclubs and all-night bars, check out this lively scene.  Weekend evenings the park is packed with elderly couples, families with small children, dapper middle-aged men and groups of young secretaries just off work, all gathered together to hear the expert marimba bands that play in the ornate ironwork kiosk. The atmosphere is festive and carefree: everyone can dance, whether alone, in pairs or in a little group, and when you are too tired to dance anymore, you can watch the others.  There are some amazing dancers, including old couples who have learned to move together gracefully through 50 years of marriage, and there are little babies who can barely stagger to the beat. Some of the participants are beautifully dressed, some are wearing flip-flops and baggy shorts, and some indigenous women in their traditional dress are selling their crafts around the edges of the park. Toddlers buy balloon toys, teens buy ice cream, families stroll around the perimeter of the park under the great ceiba trees, and the music: romantic, urgent, insistent, brings all these people together in a party atmosphere with a hint of nostalgia for the days when this was how everyone celebrated life.

373585305.name: Excellent planning and recooperation spot
373585305.author: a TripAdvisor user
373585305.reviewBody: While there isn\'t a lot to see or do right in or near Tuxtla, beside beautiful Canon (Canyon) del Sumidero and quint Chiapa de Corzo, the Tuxtla Marriott is a great spot to start.
